To create a token is to put a token onto the battlefield. See rule <a href="#cr701.6">701.6</a>, “Create.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosCreature">Creature</a></b><br>
A card type. A creature is a permanent. See rule <a href="#cr302">302</a>, “Creatures.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosCreature Type">Creature Type</a></b><br>
A subtype that’s correlated to the creature card type and the tribal card type. See rule <a href="#cr302">302</a>, “Creatures,” and rule <a href="#cr308">308</a>, “Tribals.” See rule <a href="#cr205.3s">205.3s</a> for the list of creature types.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosCrew">Crew</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets you tap creatures to turn a Vehicle into an artifact creature. See rule <a href="#cr301">301</a>, “Artifacts,” and rule <a href="#cr702.122">702.122</a>, “Crew.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosCripple">Cripple</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows certain spells to be cast for an alternative cost in an opponent lost life.  See rule <a href="#cr702.155">702.155</a>, “Cripple.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosCryptic">Cryptic</a></b><br>
An object is cryptic if it is an artifact, an enchantment, a modal instant, or a modal sorcery. See rule <a href="#cr700.15">700.15</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosCumulative Upkeep">Cumulative Upkeep</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that imposes an increasing cost to keep a permanent on the battlefield. See rule <a href="#cr702.24">702.24</a>, “Cumulative Upkeep.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosCursed">Cursed</a></b><br>
A player is cursed if they have a Curse Aura attached to them. See rule <a href="#cr700.14">700.14</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosCustom Artifacts">Custom Artifacts</a></b><br>
For a list of custom artifact subtypes, see rule <a href="#cr205.3k">205.3k</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosCustom Creatures">Custom Creatures</a></b><br>
For a list of custom creature subtypes, see rule <a href="#cr205.3k">205.3k</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosCustom Enchantments">Custom Enchantments</a></b><br>
For a list of custom enchantment subtypes, see rule <a href="#cr205.3k">205.3k</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosCustom Instants">Custom Instants, Custom Sorceries, Custom Spells</a></b><br>
For a list of custom instant and sorcery subtypes, see rule <a href="#cr205.3k">205.3k</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosCustom Lands">Custom Lands</a></b><br>
For a list of custom land subtypes, see rule <a href="#cr205.3k">205.3k</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosCustom Planeswalkers">Custom Planeswalkers</a></b><br>
For a list of custom planeswalker subtypes, see rule <a href="#cr205.3k">205.3k</a>.<br>
<br>
<br><b><a id="glosCycling">Cycling</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets a card be discarded and replaced with a new card. See rule <a href="#cr702.29">702.29</a>, “Cycling.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDamage">Damage</a></b><br>
Objects can deal “damage” to creatures, planeswalkers, and players. This is generally detrimental to the object or player that receives that damage. See rule <a href="#cr120">120</a>, “Damage.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDamage Assignment Order">Damage Assignment Order</a></b><br>
The order, announced during the declare blockers step, that an attacking creature will assign its combat damage among the multiple creatures blocking it, or that a blocking creature will assign its combat damage among the multiple creatures it’s blocking. See rules <a href="#cr509.2">509.2</a> and <a href="#cr509.3">509.3</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDash">Dash</a></b><br>
A keyword ability found on creature cards that allows them to be cast for an alternative cost. See rule <a href="#cr702.109">702.109</a>, “Dash.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDay">Day</a></b><br>
Along with night, a designation the game can have. See rule <a href="#cr724">724</a>, “Day and Night,” and rule <a href="#cr702.145">702.145</a>, “Daybound and Nightbound.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDaybound">Daybound</a></b><br>
An ability found on the front faces of some double-faced cards. Cards with daybound and nightbound are face up when it’s day and face down when it’s night. See rule <a href="#cr702.145">702.145</a>, “Daybound and Nightbound,” and rule <a href="#cr724">724</a>, “Day and Night.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDeal">Deal</a></b><br>
See <a href="#glosDamage">Damage</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDeathtouch">Deathtouch</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that causes damage dealt by an object to be especially effective. See rule <a href="#cr702.2">702.2</a>, “Deathtouch.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDecayed">Decayed</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that means “This creature can’t block” and “When this creature attacks, sacrifice it at end of combat. See rule <a href="#cr702.147">702.147</a>, “Decayed.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDeception">Deception</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets a creature suddenly enter combat. See rule <a href="#cr702.177">702.177</a>, “Deception.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDeck">Deck</a></b><br>
The collection of cards a player starts the game with; it becomes that player’s library. See rule <a href="#cr100">100</a>, “General,” and rule <a href="#cr103">103</a>, “Starting the Game.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDeclare Attackers">Declare Attackers</a></b><br>
To choose a set of creatures that will attack, declare whether each creature is attacking the defending player or a planeswalker that player controls, and pay any costs required to allow those creatures to attack. See rule <a href="#cr508.1">508.1</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDeclare Attackers Step">Declare Attackers Step</a></b><br>
Part of the turn. This step is the second step of the combat phase. See rule <a href="#cr508">508</a>, “Declare Attackers Step.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDeclare Blockers">Declare Blockers</a></b><br>
To choose a set of creatures that will block, declare which attacking creature each creature is blocking, and pay any costs required to allow those creatures to block. See rule <a href="#cr509.1">509.1</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDeclare Blockers Step">Declare Blockers Step</a></b><br>
Part of the turn. This step is the third step of the combat phase. See rule <a href="#cr509">509</a>, “Declare Blockers Step.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDefender">Defender</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that prohibits a creature from attacking. See rule <a href="#cr702.3">702.3</a>, “Defender.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDefending Player">Defending Player</a></b><br>
The player who can be attacked, and whose planeswalkers can be attacked, during the combat phase. See rule <a href="#cr506.2">506.2</a>. In certain multiplayer games, there may be more than one defending player; see rule <a href="#cr802">802</a>, “Attack Multiple Players Option,” and rule <a href="#cr805.10">805.10</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDefending Team">Defending Team</a></b><br>
The team who can be attacked, and whose planeswalkers can be attacked, during the combat phase of a multiplayer game using the shared team turns option. See rule <a href="#cr805">805</a>, “Shared Team Turns Option.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDefiance">Defiance</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that gives a creature +1/+1 counters the first time it survives damage. See rule <a href="#cr702.194">702.194</a>, “Defiance.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDelayed Triggered Ability">Delayed Triggered Ability</a></b><br>
An ability created by effects generated when some spells or abilities resolve, or when some replacement effects are applied, that does something later on rather than at that time. See rule <a href="#cr603.7">603.7</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDelve">Delve</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets you exile cards from your graveyard rather than pay generic mana to cast a spell. See rule <a href="#cr702.66">702.66</a>, “Delve.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDemonstrate">Demonstrate</a></b><br>
A triggered ability found on some spells that let its controller copy it and choose an opponent to also copy it. See rule <a href="#cr702.144">702.144</a>, “Demonstrate.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDependency">Dependency</a></b><br>
A system that may be used to determine in which order continuous effects in the same layer or sublayer are applied. See rule <a href="#cr613.8">613.8</a>. See also Timestamp Order.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDeploy Creatures Option">Deploy Creatures Option</a></b><br>
An option that may be used in certain multiplayer variants to pass control of creatures between teammates. See rule <a href="#cr804">804</a>, “Deploy Creatures Option.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDesecrate">Desecrate</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows you to sacrifice an artifact or land for some effect as certain creatures enter the battlefield. See rule <a href="#cr702.192">702.192</a>, “Desecrate.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDestroy">Destroy</a></b><br>
To move a permanent from the battlefield to its owner’s graveyard. See rule <a href="#cr701.7">701.7</a>, “Destroy.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDetain">Detain</a></b><br>
A keyword action that temporarily stops a permanent from attacking, blocking, or having its activated abilities activated. See rule <a href="#cr701.29">701.29</a>, “Detain.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDethrone">Dethrone</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that puts a +1/+1 counter on a creature when it attacks the player with the most life. See rule <a href="#cr702.105">702.105</a>, “Dethrone.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDevoid">Devoid</a></b><br>
A characteristic-defining ability that makes an object colorless. See rule <a href="#cr702.114">702.114</a>, “Devoid.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDevotion">Devotion</a></b><br>
A numerical value a player has, equal to the number of mana symbols of a certain color among the mana costs of permanents that player controls. See rule <a href="#cr700.5">700.5</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDevour">Devour</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that can have a creature enter the battlefield with +1/+1 counters on it. See rule <a href="#cr702.82">702.82</a>, “Devour.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDies">Dies</a></b><br>
A creature or planeswalker “dies” if it is put into a graveyard from the battlefield. See rule <a href="#cr700.4">700.4</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDiscard">Discard</a></b><br>
To move a card from its owner’s hand to that player’s graveyard. See rule <a href="#cr701.8">701.8</a>, “Discard.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDiscovery">Discovery</a></b><br>
A type of card that unlocks a permanent effect over several turns. See rule C728, “Discovery Cards.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDistorted">Distorted</a></b><br>
A creature with distorted can only be blocked by tapped creatures instead of untapped creatures.  See rule <a href="#cr702.156">702.156</a>, “Distorted.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDisturb">Disturb</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows a player to cast a double-faced card transformed from the graveyard. See rule <a href="#cr702.146">702.146</a>, “Disturb.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDouble Agenda">Double Agenda</a></b><br>
A variant of the hidden agenda ability. See rule <a href="#cr702.106">702.106</a>, “Hidden Agenda.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDouble Strike">Double Strike</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets a creature deal its combat damage twice. See rule <a href="#cr702.4">702.4</a>, “Double Strike.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDouble-Faced Cards">Double-Faced Cards</a></b><br>
Cards with two faces, one on each side of the card, and no Magic card back. See rule <a href="#cr712">712</a>, “Double-Faced Cards.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDraft">Draft</a></b><br>
1. A Limited format in which players choose cards one at a time from booster packs, then construct a deck solely from the chosen cards and basic land cards.<br>2. To choose a card during a draft and put it into your card pool.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDraft Round">Draft Round</a></b><br>
Part of a draft in which each player opens an unopened booster pack and the cards in those booster packs are drafted. See rules <a href="#cr905.1a">905.1a</a> and <a href="#cr905.1b">905.1b</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDraw">Draw</a></b><br>
1. To put the top card of a player’s library into their hand as a turn-based action or as the result of an effect that uses the word “draw.” See rule <a href="#cr121">121</a>, “Drawing a Card.”<br>2. The result of a game in which neither player wins or loses. See rule <a href="#cr104.4">104.4</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDraw Step">Draw Step</a></b><br>
Part of the turn. This step is the third and final step of the beginning phase. See rule <a href="#cr504">504</a>, “Draw Step.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDredge">Dredge</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets a player return a card from their graveyard to their hand. See rule <a href="#cr702.52">702.52</a>, “Dredge.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDungeon">Dungeon</a></b><br>
A card type found on nontraditional Magic cards. A dungeon card is not a permanent. See rule <a href="#cr309">309</a>, “Dungeons.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosDuring (Obsolete)">During (Obsolete)</a></b><br>
Some older cards used the phrase “during [phase], [action].” These abilities were called “phase abilities.” In general, cards that were printed with phase abilities have received errata in the Oracle card reference so they have abilities that trigger at the beginning of a step or phase. “During” still appears in current card text, but only in its normal English sense and not as game terminology.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEDH (Obsolete)">EDH (Obsolete)</a></b><br>
An older name for the Commander casual variant. See rule <a href="#cr903">903</a>, “Commander.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEcho">Echo</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that imposes a cost to keep a permanent on the battlefield. See rule <a href="#cr702.30">702.30</a>, “Echo.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEffect">Effect</a></b><br>
Something that happens in the game as a result of a spell or ability. See rule <a href="#cr609">609</a>, “Effects.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEmbalm">Embalm</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets a player exile a creature card from their graveyard to create a mummified token version of that card. See rule <a href="#cr702.128">702.128</a>, “Embalm.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEmbattled">Embattled</a></b><br>
A creature is embattled if it has a counter on it, or has a permanent attached to it that is controlled by the creature's controller. See rule <a href="#cr700.11">700.11</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEmbeliish">Embeliish</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows certain spells to be cast for an alternative cost in order to create a 1/1 blue Thopter creature token with flying. See rule <a href="#cr702.201">702.201</a>, “Embellish.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEmblem">Emblem</a></b><br>
An emblem is a marker used to represent an object that has one or more abilities, but no other characteristics. See rule <a href="#cr114">114</a>, “Emblems.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEmbody">Embody</a></b><br>
A keyword ability of Auras that makes enchanted creature a copy of it, other than its types. See rule <a href="#cr702.185">702.185</a>, “Embody.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEmerge">Emerge</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets a player cast a spell for less by sacrificing a creature. See rule <a href="#cr702.119">702.119</a>, “Emerge.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEmperor">Emperor</a></b><br>
The middle player on each team in an Emperor game. See rule <a href="#cr809">809</a>, “Emperor Variant.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEmperor Variant">Emperor Variant</a></b><br>
A multiplayer variant played among three-player teams. See rule <a href="#cr809">809</a>, “Emperor Variant.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEnchant">Enchant</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that defines what an Aura spell can target and what an Aura permanent can be attached to. See rule <a href="#cr303">303</a>, “Enchantments,” and rule <a href="#cr702.5">702.5</a>, “Enchant.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEnchantment">Enchantment</a></b><br>
A card type. An enchantment is a permanent. See rule <a href="#cr303">303</a>, “Enchantments.” See also Aura.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEnchantment Type">Enchantment Type</a></b><br>
A subtype that’s correlated to the enchantment card type. See rule <a href="#cr303">303</a>, “Enchantments.” See rule <a href="#cr205.3i">205.3i</a> for the list of enchantment types.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEncoded">Encoded</a></b><br>
A term that describes the relationship between a permanent and a card exiled by a cipher ability. See rule <a href="#cr702.99">702.99</a>, “Cipher.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEncore">Encore</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets a player exile a creature card from their graveyard to, for each opponent, create a token that’s a copy of that card to attack that opponent. See rule <a href="#cr702.141">702.141</a>, “Encore”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEncounter">Encounter</a></b><br>
To move a phenomenon card off the top of a planar deck and turn it face up. See rule <a href="#cr311">311</a>, “Phenomena.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEncourage">Encourage</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows a creature to tap to give another creature +1/+1. See rule <a href="#cr702.202">702.202</a>, “Encourage.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEnd Step">End Step</a></b><br>
Part of the turn. This step is the first step of the ending phase. See rule <a href="#cr513">513</a>, “End Step.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEnd of Combat Step">End of Combat Step</a></b><br>
Part of the turn. This step is the fifth and final step of the combat phase. See rule <a href="#cr511">511</a>, “End of Combat Step.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEnd the Combat Phase">End the Combat Phase</a></b><br>
To “end the combat phase” as the result of an effect is to perform an expedited process that skips everything else that would happen that phase. See rule <a href="#cr719">719</a>, “Ending Turns and Phases.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEnd the Turn">End the Turn</a></b><br>
To “end the turn” as the result of an effect is to perform an expedited process that skips nearly everything else that would happen that turn. See rule <a href="#cr719">719</a>, “Ending Turns and Phases.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEnding Phase">Ending Phase</a></b><br>
Part of the turn. This phase is the fifth and final phase of the turn. See rule <a href="#cr512">512</a>, “Ending Phase.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEnergy Symbol">Energy Symbol</a></b><br>
The energy symbol {E} represents one energy counter. To pay {E}, a player removes one energy counter from themselves.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEngage">Engage</a></b><br>
A keyword abiity that requires a creature be blocked if able.See rule <a href="#cr702.174">702.174</a>, “Engage.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEngorge">Engorge</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that mills three cards, then exiles one as a creature enters, and does something with the exiled card.  See rule <a href="#cr702.157">702.157</a>, “Engorge.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEnspirit">Enspirit</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows certain spells to be discounted by temporarily exiling a permanent. See rule <a href="#cr702.195">702.195</a>, “Enspirit.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEnters the Battlefield">Enters the Battlefield</a></b><br>
A nontoken permanent “enters the battlefield” when it’s moved onto the battlefield from another zone. A token “enters the battlefield” when it’s created. See rules <a href="#cr403.3">403.3</a>, 603.6a, 603.6d, and <a href="#cr614.12">614.12</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEntwine">Entwine</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets a player choose all modes for a spell rather than just the number specified. See rule <a href="#cr702.42">702.42</a>, “Entwine.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEpic">Epic</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets a player copy a spell at the beginning of each of their upkeeps at the expense of casting any other spells for the rest of the game. See rule <a href="#cr702.50">702.50</a>, “Epic.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEquip">Equip</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets a player attach an Equipment to a creature they control. See rule <a href="#cr301">301</a>, “Artifacts,” and rule <a href="#cr702.6">702.6</a>, “Equip.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEquipment">Equipment</a></b><br>
An artifact subtype. Equipment can be attached to creatures. See rule <a href="#cr301">301</a>, “Artifacts,” and rule <a href="#cr702.6">702.6</a>, “Equip.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosErratic">Erratic</a></b><br>
When a creature with erratic dies, it puts a creature with lesser mana value from the top four cards of your library onto the battlefield. See rule <a href="#cr702.158">702.158</a>, “Erratic.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEscalate">Escalate</a></b><br>
A keyword ability on some modal spells that adds a cost for choosing additional modes. See rule <a href="#cr702.120">702.120</a>, “Escalate.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEscapade">Escapade</a></b><br>
A type of card that triggers certain abilities via a particular trigger. See rule C732, “Escapade Cards.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEscape">Escape</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets a player cast a card from their graveyard. See rule <a href="#cr702.138">702.138</a>, “Escape.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEternalize">Eternalize</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets a player exile a creature card from their graveyard to create an eternalized token version of that card. See rule <a href="#cr702.129">702.129</a>, “Eternalize.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEureka!">Eureka!</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that gives a player research counters on turns where they cast spells, then trades eight of them for special Masterpiece tokens. See rule <a href="#cr702.198">702.198</a>, “Eureka!.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEvasion Ability">Evasion Ability</a></b><br>
An ability that restricts what creatures can block an attacking creature. See rules <a href="#cr509.1b">509.1b</a>–c.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEvent">Event</a></b><br>
Anything that happens in a game. See rule <a href="#cr700.1">700.1</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEvoke">Evoke</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that causes a permanent to be sacrificed when it enters the battlefield. See rule <a href="#cr702.74">702.74</a>, “Evoke.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosEvolve">Evolve</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets you put a +1/+1 counter on a creature when a larger creature enters the battlefield under your control. See rule <a href="#cr702.100">702.100</a>, “Evolve.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosExalted">Exalted</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that can make a creature better in combat. See rule <a href="#cr702.83">702.83</a>, “Exalted.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosExcess Damage">Excess Damage</a></b><br>
Damage dealt to a creature greater than what would be lethal damage or damage dealt to a planeswalker greater than its loyalty. See rule <a href="#cr120.4a">120.4a</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosExchange">Exchange</a></b><br>
To swap two things, such as objects, sets of objects, or life totals. See rule <a href="#cr701.10">701.10</a>, “Exchange.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosExert">Exert</a></b><br>
A keyword action that stops a permanent from untapping during the next untap step of the player who exerted it. See rule <a href="#cr701.39">701.39</a>, “Exert.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosExile">Exile</a></b><br>
1. A zone. Exile is essentially a holding area for cards. It used to be known as the “removed-from-the-game” zone.<br>2. To put an object into the exile zone from whatever zone it’s currently in. An “exiled” card is one that’s been put into the exile zone.<br>See rule <a href="#cr406">406</a>, “Exile.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosExpansion Symbol">Expansion Symbol</a></b><br>
A card’s expansion symbol is a small icon normally printed below the right edge of the illustration that has no effect on game play. See rule <a href="#cr206">206</a>, “Expansion Symbol.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosExperience">Experience</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that puts a +1/+1 counter on a creature the first three times it attacks. See rule <a href="#cr702.159">702.159</a>, “Experience.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosExploit">Exploit</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets you sacrifice a creature for a benefit. See rule <a href="#cr702.110">702.110</a>, “Exploit.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosExplore">Explore</a></b><br>
A keyword action that causes a player to reveal the top card of their library and then to take different actions depending on whether a land card is revealed this way. See rule <a href="#cr701.40">701.40</a>, “Explore.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosExtort">Extort</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets you gain life and have opponents lose life whenever you cast a spell. See rule <a href="#cr702.101">702.101</a>, “Extort.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosExtra Turn">Extra Turn</a></b><br>
A turn created by an effect of a spell or ability. See rule <a href="#cr500.7">500.7</a>. For rules about extra turns in a multiplayer game using the shared team turns option, see 805.8. For rules about extra turns in a Grand Melee game, see rule <a href="#cr807.4">807.4</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosFabled">Fabled</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows certain spells to be cast for an alternative mana cost to put them onto the battlefield transformed as they resolve. See rule <a href="#cr702.160">702.160</a>, “Fabled.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosFabricate">Fabricate</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets you choose whether to create Servo tokens or put +1/+1 counters on a creature. See rule <a href="#cr702.123">702.123</a>, “Fabricate.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosFace Down">Face Down</a></b><br>
1. A card is “face down” if it’s physically positioned so the card back is showing. Cards in some zones are normally kept face down. See <a href="#cr4">section 4</a>, “Zones.”<br>2. A status a permanent may have. See rule <a href="#cr110.5">110.5</a> and rule <a href="#cr702.37">702.37</a>, “Morph.”<br>3. Face-down spells have additional rules. See rule <a href="#cr708">708</a>, “Face-Down Spells and Permanents,” and rule <a href="#cr702.37">702.37</a>, “Morph.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosFace Up">Face Up</a></b><br>
1. A card is “face up” if it’s physically positioned so the card front is showing. Cards in some zones are normally kept face up. See <a href="#cr4">section 4</a>, “Zones.”<br>2. A default status a permanent may have. See rule <a href="#cr110.5">110.5</a> and rule <a href="#cr702.37">702.37</a>, “Morph.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosFading">Fading</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that limits how long a permanent remains on the battlefield. See rule <a href="#cr702.32">702.32</a>, “Fading.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosFateseal">Fateseal</a></b><br>
To manipulate some of the cards on top of an opponent’s library. See rule <a href="#cr701.22">701.22</a>, “Fateseal.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosFealty">Fealty</a></b><br>
A player's fealty to a type is equal to the number of permanents of that type they control. See rule <a href="#cr700.13">700.13</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosFear">Fear</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that restricts how a creature may be blocked. See rule <a href="#cr702.36">702.36</a>, “Fear.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosFight">Fight</a></b><br>
When two creatures fight, each deals damage equal to its power to the other. See rule <a href="#cr701.12">701.12</a>, “Fight.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosFirst Strike">First Strike</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets a creature deal its combat damage before other creatures. See rule <a href="#cr702.7">702.7</a>, “First Strike.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosFirst mate">First mate</a></b><br>
A variant of the companion ability that allows swapping a card in your opening hand with a first mate that meets a condition. See rule <a href="#cr702.139">702.139</a>, “Companion.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosFlanking">Flanking</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that can make a creature better in combat. See rule <a href="#cr702.25">702.25</a>, “Flanking.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosFlash">Flash</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets a player play a card any time they could cast an instant. See rule <a href="#cr702.8">702.8</a>, “Flash.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosFlashback">Flashback</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets a player cast a card from their graveyard. See rule <a href="#cr702.34">702.34</a>, “Flashback.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosFlavor Text">Flavor Text</a></b><br>
Text in italics (but not in parentheses) in the text box of a card that has no effect on play. See rule <a href="#cr207.2">207.2</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosFlavor Word">Flavor Word</a></b><br>
An italicized word with no rules meaning that provides a flavorful description of an ability. See rule <a href="#cr207.2d">207.2d</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosFlip Cards">Flip Cards</a></b><br>
Cards with a two-part card frame (one part of which is printed upside down) on a single card. See rule <a href="#cr710">710</a>, “Flip Cards.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosFlipped">Flipped</a></b><br>
A status a permanent may have. See rule <a href="#cr110.5">110.5</a> and rule <a href="#cr710">710</a>, “Flip Cards.” See also Unflipped.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosFlipping a Coin">Flipping a Coin</a></b><br>
A method of randomization with two possible outcomes of equal likelihood. See rule <a href="#cr705">705</a>, “Flipping a Coin.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosFlying">Flying</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that restricts how a creature may be blocked. See rule <a href="#cr702.9">702.9</a>, “Flying.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosFood Token">Food Token</a></b><br>
A Food token is a colorless artifact token with “{2}, {T}, Sacrifice this artifact: You gain 3 life.” For more information about predefined tokens, see rule <a href="#cr111.10">111.10</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosForebode">Forebode</a></b><br>
A keyword action that causes a player to create an Omen token. See rule <a href="#cr701.70">701.70</a>, “Forebode.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosForecast">Forecast</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows an activated ability to be activated from a player’s hand. See rule <a href="#cr702.57">702.57</a>, “Forecast.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosForest">Forest</a></b><br>
One of the five basic land types. Any land with this subtype has the ability “{T}: Add {G}.” See rule <a href="#cr305.6">305.6</a>.<br>
<br>
<b><a id="glosForestwalk">Forestwalk, Islandwalk, Mountainwalk, Plainswalk, Swampwalk</a></b><br>
See <a href="#glosLandwalk">Landwalk</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosForetell">Foretell</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets a player exile cards from their hand and cast them for an alternative cost on future turns. See rule <a href="#cr702.143">702.143</a>, “Foretell.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosForetold">Foretold</a></b><br>
A card exiled using the foretell special action becomes foretold. Other effects can also make an exiled card foretold. A spell was foretold if it was a foretold card in exile before it was cast.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosFortification">Fortification</a></b><br>
An artifact subtype. Fortifications can be attached to lands. See rule <a href="#cr301">301</a>, “Artifacts,” and rule <a href="#cr702.67">702.67</a>, “Fortify.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosFortify">Fortify</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets a player attach a Fortification to a land they control. See rule <a href="#cr301">301</a>, “Artifacts,” and rule <a href="#cr702.67">702.67</a>, “Fortify.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosFree-for-All">Free-for-All</a></b><br>
A multiplayer variant in which a group of players compete as individuals against each other. See rule <a href="#cr806">806</a>, “Free-for-All Variant.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosFrenzy">Frenzy</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that can make a creature better in combat. See rule <a href="#cr702.68">702.68</a>, “Frenzy.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosFriends Forever">Friends Forever</a></b><br>
A variant of the partner ability that lets two legendary creatures be your commander in the Commander variant rather than one if both have the friends forever ability. See rule <a href="#cr702.124">702.124</a>, “Partner,” and rule <a href="#cr903">903</a>, “Commander.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosFull Party">Full Party</a></b><br>
A player has a full party if the number of creatures in their party is four. See rule <a href="#cr700.8">700.8</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosFuse">Fuse</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows a player to cast both halves of a split card. See rule <a href="#cr702.102">702.102</a>, “Fuse.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosFused Split Spell">Fused Split Spell</a></b><br>
A split card on the stack that has been cast using the fuse ability or a copy of such a card. See rule <a href="#cr702.102">702.102</a>, “Fuse.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosGeneral">General</a></b><br>
Any player in the Emperor multiplayer variant who isn’t an emperor. See rule <a href="#cr809">809</a>, “Emperor Variant.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosGeneric Mana">Generic Mana</a></b><br>
Mana in a cost represented by numerical symbols (such as {1}) or variable symbols (such as {X}) that can be paid with mana of any type. See rule <a href="#cr107.4">107.4</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosGerminate">Germinate</a></b><br>
A keyword action that causes a player to put +1/+1 counters on a creature or create a number of 1/1 green Saporling creature tokens. See rule <a href="#cr701.61">701.61</a>, “Germinate.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosGestalt">Gestalt</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that merged permanents together as they enter the battlefield. See rule <a href="#cr702.205">702.205</a>, “Gestalt.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosGlitch">Glitch</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows restrictions to be removed from a spell by paying additional costs. See rule <a href="#cr702.211">702.211</a>, “Glitch.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosGlobal Enchantment (Obsolete)">Global Enchantment (Obsolete)</a></b><br>
An obsolete term for a non-Aura enchantment. Cards printed with this text have received errata in the Oracle card reference.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosGlorious">Glorious</a></b><br>
Having one or more glory counters. See rule <a href="#cr122.1f">122.1f</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosGlory">Glory, Glory Counters</a></b><br>
A counter that can be given to a player. Players lose glory counters before life. A player with ten glory counters wins the game. See rule <a href="#cr104.2e">104.2e</a>, rule <a href="#cr119.11">119.11</a><br>
<br>
<b><a id="glosGoad">Goad</a></b><br>
A keyword action that causes a creature to be goaded until a player’s next turn. See rule <a href="#cr701.38">701.38</a>, “Goad.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosGoaded">Goaded</a></b><br>
A designation a permanent can have. Goaded creatures are forced to attack and to attack a player other than the player that caused it to be goaded. See rule <a href="#cr701.38">701.38</a>, “Goad.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosGold Token">Gold Token</a></b><br>
A Gold token is a colorless artifact token with “Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.” For more information on predefined tokens, see rule <a href="#cr111.10">111.10</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosGraft">Graft</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that has a permanent enter the battlefield with +1/+1 counters on it and can move those counters to other creatures. See rule <a href="#cr702.58">702.58</a>, “Graft.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosGrand Melee">Grand Melee</a></b><br>
A multiplayer variant in which a large group of players (usually ten or more) compete as individuals against each other. See rule <a href="#cr807">807</a>, “Grand Melee Variant.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosGravestorm">Gravestorm</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that creates copies of a spell. See rule <a href="#cr702.69">702.69</a>, “Gravestorm.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosGraveyard">Graveyard</a></b><br>
1. A zone. A player’s graveyard is their discard pile.<br>2. All the cards in a player’s graveyard.<br>See rule <a href="#cr404">404</a>, “Graveyard.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosHand">Hand</a></b><br>
1. A zone. A player’s hand is where that player holds cards they have drawn but not played yet.<br>2. All the cards in a player’s hand.<br>See rule <a href="#cr402">402</a>, “Hand.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosHand Modifier">Hand Modifier</a></b><br>
A characteristic that only vanguards have. See rule <a href="#cr210">210</a>, “Hand Modifier.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosHarmonize">Harmonize</a></b><br>
A keyword action that triggers a harmony ability of one permanent you control. See rule <a href="#cr701.60">701.60</a>, “Harmonize.” and rule <a href="#cr702.196">702.196</a> “Harmony.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosHarmony">Harmony</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that is triggered by the harmoize action. See rule <a href="#cr702.196">702.196</a>, “Harmony.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosHarness">Harness</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows certain spells to be discounted by tapping a creature. See rule <a href="#cr702.206">702.206</a>, “Harness.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosHarvest">Harvest</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows certain spells to be cast for a discount by tapping creatures. See rule <a href="#cr702.186">702.186</a>, “Harvest.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosHaste">Haste</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets a creature ignore the “summoning sickness” rule. See rule <a href="#cr702.10">702.10</a>, “Haste,” and rule <a href="#cr302.6">302.6</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosHaunt">Haunt</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that exiles cards. A card exiled this way “haunts” a creature targeted by the haunt ability. See rule <a href="#cr702.55">702.55</a>, “Haunt.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosHeretic">Heretic</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that causes a creature to get +1/+1 whenever its controller casts a spell that doesn't share a color with it.See rule <a href="#cr702.175">702.175</a>, “Heretic.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosHexproof">Hexproof</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that precludes a permanent or player from being targeted by an opponent. See rule <a href="#cr702.11">702.11</a>, “Hexproof.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosHidden Agenda">Hidden Agenda</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows a conspiracy card to be put into the command zone face down. See rule <a href="#cr702.106">702.106</a>, “Hidden Agenda.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosHidden Zone">Hidden Zone</a></b><br>
A zone in which not all players can be expected to see the cards’ faces. See rule <a href="#cr400.2">400.2</a>. See also Public Zone.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosHideaway">Hideaway</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets a player store a secret card. See rule <a href="#cr702.75">702.75</a>, “Hideaway.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosHistoric">Historic</a></b><br>
An object is historic if it has the legendary supertype, the artifact card type, or the Saga subtype. See rule <a href="#cr700.6">700.6</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosHorsemanship">Horsemanship</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that restricts how a creature may be blocked. See rule <a href="#cr702.31">702.31</a>, “Horsemanship.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosHybrid Card">Hybrid Card</a></b><br>
A card with one or more hybrid mana symbols in its mana cost. See rule <a href="#cr202.2f">202.2f</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosHybrid Mana Symbols">Hybrid Mana Symbols</a></b><br>
A mana symbol that represents a cost that can be paid in one of two ways. See rule <a href="#cr107.4">107.4</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosHybrid Phyrexian Mana Symbols">Hybrid Phyrexian Mana Symbols</a></b><br>
A mana symbol that represents a cost that can be paid in one of three ways. See rule <a href="#cr107.4">107.4</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosIdolize">Idolize</a></b><br>
A keyword action that makes an Idol artifact token. See rule <a href="#cr701.50">701.50</a>, “Idolize.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosIf">If</a></b><br>
See <a href="#glosIntervening “If” Clause">Intervening “If” Clause</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosIllegal Action">Illegal Action</a></b><br>
An action that violates the rules of the game and/or requirements or restrictions created by effects. See rule <a href="#cr726">726</a>, “Handling Illegal Actions.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosIllegal Target">Illegal Target</a></b><br>
A target that no longer exists or no longer meets the specifications stated by the spell or ability that’s targeting it. See rule <a href="#cr608.2b">608.2b</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosIllustration">Illustration</a></b><br>
A picture printed on the upper half of a card that has no effect on game play. See rule <a href="#cr203">203</a>, “Illustration.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosIllustration Credit">Illustration Credit, Legal Text</a></b><br>
Information printed directly below the text box that has no effect on game play. See rule <a href="#cr212">212</a>, “Information Below the Text Box.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosImprint">Imprint</a></b><br>
“Imprint” used to be a keyword ability. It is now an ability word and has no rules meaning. All cards printed with the imprint keyword have received errata in the Oracle card reference.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosImprove">Improve</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that puts a +1/+1 counter on a creature for an increasing cost. See rule <a href="#cr702.222">702.222</a>, “Improve.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosImprovise">Improvise</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets you tap artifacts rather than pay mana to cast a spell. See rule <a href="#cr702.126">702.126</a>, “Improvise.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosIn Play (Obsolete)">In Play (Obsolete)</a></b><br>
An obsolete term for the battlefield. Cards that were printed with text that contain the phrases “in play,” “from play,” “into play,” or the like are referring to the battlefield and have received errata in the Oracle card reference. See Battlefield.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosIn Response To">In Response To</a></b><br>
An instant spell that’s been cast, or an activated ability that’s been activated, while another spell or ability is on the stack has been cast or activated “in response to” the earlier spell or ability. See rule <a href="#cr117.7">117.7</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosIndependent">Independent</a></b><br>
See <a href="#glosDependency">Dependency</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosIndestructible">Indestructible</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that precludes a permanent from being destroyed. See rule <a href="#cr702.12">702.12</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosInfamy">Infamy</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that makes a creature stronger after it deals combat damage to a player. See rule C702.219 “Infamy.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosInfect">Infect</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that affects how an object deals damage to creatures and players. See rule <a href="#cr702.90">702.90</a>, “Infect.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosInfiltrate">Infiltrate</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that gives a certain creature +1/+1 for each unblocked attacking creature. See rule <a href="#cr702.161">702.161</a>, “Infiltrate.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosIngest">Ingest</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that can exile the top card of a player’s library. See rule <a href="#cr702.115">702.115</a>, “Ingest.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosInnovate">Innovate</a></b><br>
A player innovates as they cast a spell beyond their first in a turn, draw a card beyond their first in a turn, or have a land enter the battlefield under their control except for the first time in a turn. See rule <a href="#cr700.16">700.16</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosInscribe">Inscribe</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows a spell to be exiled and cast when a creature attacks. See rule <a href="#cr702.162">702.162</a>, “Inscribe.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosInstant">Instant</a></b><br>
A card type. An instant is not a permanent. See rule <a href="#cr304">304</a>, “Instants.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosInstead">Instead</a></b><br>
Effects that use the word “instead” are replacement effects. The word “instead” indicates what an event will be replaced with. See rule <a href="#cr614">614</a>, “Replacement Effects.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosInterrupt (Obsolete)">Interrupt (Obsolete)</a></b><br>
An obsolete card type. All cards printed with this card type are now instants. All abilities that, as printed, said a player could “play as an interrupt” can now be activated like any other activated abilities (unless they’re mana abilities, in which case they follow those rules instead). All relevant cards have been given errata in the Oracle card reference.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosIntervening If Clause">Intervening If Clause</a></b><br>
A specially worded condition checked as a triggered ability would trigger and again as it would resolve. See rule <a href="#cr603.4">603.4</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosIntimidate">Intimidate</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that restricts how a creature may be blocked. See rule <a href="#cr702.13">702.13</a>, “Intimidate.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosInvestigate">Investigate</a></b><br>
A keyword action that creates a Clue artifact token. See rule <a href="#cr701.36">701.36</a>, “Investigate.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosInvigorate">Invigorate</a></b><br>
A keyword action that puts +1/+1 counters on a creature you control with the least power. See rule <a href="#cr701.51">701.51</a>, “Invigorate.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosIsland">Island</a></b><br>
One of the five basic land types. Any land with this subtype has the ability “{T}: Add {U}.” See rule <a href="#cr305.6">305.6</a>.<br>
<br>
<b><a id="glosIslandhome (Obsolete)">Islandhome (Obsolete)</a></b><br>
An obsolete keyword ability that meant “This creature can’t attack unless defending player controls an Island” and “When you control no Islands, sacrifice this creature.” Cards printed with this ability have been given errata in the Oracle card reference.<br>
<br>
<b><a id="glosJourney">Journey</a></b><br>
A keyword action that exiles the top card of your library, and returns those cards to your hand when your creatures deal combat damage to players. See rule <a href="#cr701.58">701.58</a>, “Journey.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosJudge">Judge</a></b><br>
A keyword action that allows a player to put a +1/+1 counter on a permanent, or sacrifice it to draw a card. See rule C701.75.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosJump-Start">Jump-Start</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets a player cast a card from their graveyard by discarding a card. See rule <a href="#cr702.133">702.133</a>, “Jump-Start.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosKeyword Ability">Keyword Ability</a></b><br>
A game term, such as “flying” or “haste,” used as shorthand for a longer ability or group of abilities. See rule <a href="#cr702">702</a>, “Keyword Abilities.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosKeyword Action">Keyword Action</a></b><br>
A verb, such as “destroy” or “cast,” used as a game term rather than as its normal English meaning. See rule <a href="#cr701">701</a>, “Keyword Actions.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosKeyword Counter">Keyword Counter</a></b><br>
A marker placed on an object that modifies its characteristics by granting it a keyword. See rule <a href="#cr122">122</a>, “Counters.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosKicked">Kicked, Kicker</a></b><br>
Kicker is a keyword ability that represents an optional additional cost. A spell has been kicked if its controller declared the intention to pay any or all of its kicker costs. See rule <a href="#cr702.33">702.33</a>, “Kicker.”<br>
<br>
<b><a id="glosKindle">Kindle</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows certain cards to be exiled from graveyards to create a number of 1/1 colorless Elemental creature tokens. See rule <a href="#cr702.172">702.172</a>, “Kindle.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosLand">Land</a></b><br>
A card type. A land is a permanent. See rule <a href="#cr305">305</a>, “Lands.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosLand Type">Land Type</a></b><br>
A subtype that’s correlated to the land card type. See rule <a href="#cr305">305</a>, “Lands.” See rule <a href="#cr205.3k">205.3k</a> for the list of land types.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosLandwalk">Landwalk</a></b><br>
A generic term for a group of keyword abilities that restrict whether a creature may be blocked. See rule <a href="#cr702.14">702.14</a>, “Landwalk.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosLast Known Information">Last Known Information</a></b><br>
Information about an object that’s no longer in the zone it’s expected to be in, or information about a player who’s no longer in the game. This information captures that object’s last existence in that zone or that player’s last existence in the game. See rules <a href="#cr113.7a">113.7a</a>, 608.2b, 608.2h, and <a href="#cr800.4h">800.4h</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosLayer">Layer</a></b><br>
A system used to determine in which order continuous effects are applied. See rule <a href="#cr613">613</a>, “Interaction of Continuous Effects.” See also Dependency, Timestamp Order.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosLayer 7e">Layer 7e</a></b><br>
A new layer that controls effects that set creature's power to a particular value. See rule <a href="#cr613.4">613.4</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosLearn">Learn</a></b><br>
A keyword action that lets a player add a Lesson card to their hand from outside the game or discard a card to draw a card. See rule <a href="#cr701.45">701.45</a>, “Learn.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosLeaves the Battlefield">Leaves the Battlefield</a></b><br>
A permanent “leaves the battlefield” when it’s moved from the battlefield to another zone, or (if it’s phased in) when it leaves the game because its owner leaves the game. See rules <a href="#cr603.6c">603.6c</a> and <a href="#cr603.10">603.10</a>.<br>
<br>
<b><a id="glosLegend (Obsolete)">Legend (Obsolete)</a></b><br>
An obsolete creature type. Cards printed with this subtype have been given errata in the Oracle card reference so they have the legendary supertype instead. See Legendary.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosLegend Rule">Legend Rule</a></b><br>
A state-based action that causes a player who controls two or more legendary permanents with the same name to put all but one into their owners’ graveyards. See rule <a href="#cr704.5j">704.5j</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosLegendary">Legendary</a></b><br>
A supertype that’s normally relevant on permanents. See rule <a href="#cr205.4">205.4</a>, “Supertypes.” See also Legend Rule.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosLeitmotif">Leitmotif</a></b><br>
A keyword ability tht allows an instant or sorcery to be cast a second time. See rule <a href="#cr702.200">702.200</a>, “Leitmotif.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosLethal Damage">Lethal Damage</a></b><br>
An amount of damage greater than or equal to a creature’s toughness. See rules <a href="#cr120.4a">120.4a</a>, 120.6, 510.1, and <a href="#cr704.5g">704.5g</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosLevel">Level</a></b><br>
A numerical designation a permanent may have. A Class enchantment’s level determines what other abilities it has. See rule <a href="#cr717">717</a>, “Class Cards.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosLevel Symbol">Level Symbol</a></b><br>
A symbol that represents a keyword ability indicating abilities, power, and toughness a leveler card may have. See rule <a href="#cr107.8">107.8</a> and rule <a href="#cr711">711</a>, “Leveler Cards.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosLevel Up">Level Up</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that can put level counters on a creature. See rule <a href="#cr702.87">702.87</a>, “Level Up.” For class level abilities of Class cards, see rule <a href="#cr717">717</a>, “Class Cards.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosLeveler Cards">Leveler Cards</a></b><br>
Cards with striated text boxes and three power/toughness boxes. See rule <a href="#cr711">711</a>, “Leveler Cards.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosLibrary">Library</a></b><br>
1. A zone. A player’s library is where that player draws cards from.<br>2. All the cards in a player’s library.<br>See rule <a href="#cr401">401</a>, “Library.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosLife">Life, Life Total</a></b><br>
Each player has an amount of “life,” represented by that player’s “life total.” Life may be gained or lost. See rule <a href="#cr119">119</a>, “Life.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosLife Modifier">Life Modifier</a></b><br>
A characteristic that only vanguards have. See rule <a href="#cr211">211</a>, “Life Modifier.”<br>
<br>
<b><a id="glosLifelink">Lifelink</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that causes a player to gain life. See rule <a href="#cr702.15">702.15</a>, “Lifelink.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosLimited">Limited</a></b><br>
A way of playing in which each player gets a quantity of unopened Magic product and creates their own deck on the spot. See rule <a href="#cr100.2">100.2</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosLimited Range of Influence">Limited Range of Influence</a></b><br>
An optional rule used in some multiplayer games that limits what a player can affect. See rule <a href="#cr801">801</a>, “Limited Range of Influence Option.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosLinked Abilities">Linked Abilities</a></b><br>
Two abilities printed on the same object such that one of them causes actions to be taken or objects to be affected and the other one directly refers to those actions or objects. See rule <a href="#cr607">607</a>, “Linked Abilities.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosLiving Weapon">Living Weapon</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that creates a creature token and then attaches the Equipment with the ability to that token. See rule <a href="#cr702.92">702.92</a>, “Living Weapon.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosLocal Enchantment (Obsolete)">Local Enchantment (Obsolete)</a></b><br>
An obsolete term for an Aura. Cards printed with this text have received errata in the Oracle card reference.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosLondon Mulligan">London Mulligan</a></b><br>
Informal term for the current system of mulligan rules. See rule <a href="#cr103.4">103.4</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosLoop">Loop</a></b><br>
A set of actions that could be repeated indefinitely. See rule <a href="#cr725">725</a>, “Taking Shortcuts.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosLose the Game">Lose the Game</a></b><br>
There are several ways to lose the game. See rule <a href="#cr104">104</a>, “Ending the Game,” rule <a href="#cr810.8">810.8</a> (for additional rules for Two-Headed Giant games), rule <a href="#cr809.5">809.5</a> (for additional rules for Emperor games), and rule <a href="#cr903.10">903.10</a> (for an additional rule for Commander games).<br>
<br><b><a id="glosLoyalty">Loyalty</a></b><br>
1. Part of a card that only planeswalkers have. A planeswalker card’s loyalty is printed in its lower right corner. See rule <a href="#cr209">209</a>, “Loyalty.”<br>2. A characteristic that only planeswalkers have. See rule <a href="#cr306.5">306.5</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosLoyalty Ability">Loyalty Ability</a></b><br>
An activated ability with a loyalty symbol in its cost. See rule <a href="#cr606">606</a>, “Loyalty Abilities.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMadness">Madness</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets a player cast a card they discard. See rule <a href="#cr702.35">702.35</a>, “Madness.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMain Game">Main Game</a></b><br>
The game in which a spell (or ability) that created a subgame was cast (or activated). See rule <a href="#cr722">722</a>, “Subgames.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMain Phase">Main Phase</a></b><br>
Part of the turn. The first, or precombat, main phase is the second phase of the turn. The second, or postcombat, main phase is the fourth phase of the turn. See rule <a href="#cr505">505</a>, “Main Phase.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMana">Mana</a></b><br>
The primary resource in the game. It is spent to pay costs, usually when casting spells and activating abilities. See rule <a href="#cr106">106</a>, “Mana,” rule <a href="#cr107.4">107.4</a>, and rule <a href="#cr202">202</a>, “Mana Cost and Color.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMana Ability">Mana Ability</a></b><br>
An activated or triggered ability that could create mana and doesn’t use the stack. See rule <a href="#cr605">605</a>, “Mana Abilities.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMana Burn (Obsolete)">Mana Burn (Obsolete)</a></b><br>
Older versions of the rules stated that unspent mana caused a player to lose life; this was called “mana burn.” That rule no longer exists.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMana Cost">Mana Cost</a></b><br>
A characteristic, and part of a card. A card’s mana cost is indicated by the mana symbols printed in its upper right corner. See rule <a href="#cr107.4">107.4</a> and rule <a href="#cr202">202</a>, “Mana Cost and Color.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMana Pool">Mana Pool</a></b><br>
Where mana created by an effect is temporarily stored. See rule <a href="#cr106.4">106.4</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMana Source (Obsolete)">Mana Source (Obsolete)</a></b><br>
An obsolete card type. All cards printed with this card type are now instants. All abilities that, as printed, said a player could “play as a mana source” are now mana abilities. All relevant cards have been given errata in the Oracle card reference.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMana Symbol">Mana Symbol</a></b><br>
An icon that represents mana or a mana cost. See rule <a href="#cr107.4">107.4</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMana Value">Mana Value</a></b><br>
The total amount of mana in a mana cost, regardless of color. See rule <a href="#cr202.3">202.3</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosManifest">Manifest</a></b><br>
A keyword action that puts a card onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. See rule <a href="#cr701.34">701.34</a>, “Manifest,” and rule <a href="#cr708">708</a>, “Face-Down Spells and Permanents.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMark">Mark</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that marks creatures when certain creatures attack. See rule <a href="#cr702.189">702.189</a>, “Mark.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMatch">Match</a></b><br>
A multiplayer game or a two-player series of games (usually best-two-of-three) played in a tournament. See rule <a href="#cr100.6">100.6</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMaximum Hand Size">Maximum Hand Size</a></b><br>
The number of cards in hand a player must discard down to during their cleanup step. See rule <a href="#cr402.2">402.2</a> and <a href="#cr514.1">514.1</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMegamorph">Megamorph</a></b><br>
A variant of the morph ability that puts a +1/+1 counter on the creature as it turns face up. See rule <a href="#cr702.37">702.37</a>, “Morph.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMeld">Meld</a></b><br>
To turn two members of a meld pair so their back faces are up and combined into one oversized Magic card. See rule <a href="#cr701.37">701.37</a>, “Meld.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMeld Cards">Meld Cards</a></b><br>
Cards with a Magic card face on one side and half of an oversized Magic card face on the other. See rule <a href="#cr713">713</a>, “Meld Cards.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMelee">Melee</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that improves an attacking creature based on the number of opponents you attacked. See rule <a href="#cr702.121">702.121</a>, “Melee.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMemento">Memento</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows certain cards to be cast from a graveyard, and then enter the battelfield transformed after. See rule <a href="#cr702.199">702.199</a>, “Memento.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMenace">Menace</a></b><br>
An evasion ability that makes creatures unblockable by a single creature. See rule <a href="#cr702.111">702.111</a>, “Menace.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMentor">Mentor</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets your bigger creatures power up your smaller creatures when they attack together. See rule <a href="#cr702.134">702.134</a>, “Mentor.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMerged Permanent">Merged Permanent</a></b><br>
A card or token may merge with a permanent to form a merged permanent. This merged permanent is represented by more than one card and/or token. See rule <a href="#cr723">723</a>, “Merging with Permanents.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMetamorph">Metamorph</a></b><br>
A variant of the morph ability that allows the card to be turned face up and put onto the stack. See rule C702.190c, “Metamorph.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMill">Mill</a></b><br>
To mill a number of cards, a player puts that many cards from the top of their library into their graveyard. See rule <a href="#cr701.13">701.13</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMimic">Mimic</a></b><br>
A keyword ability of leveler cards that allow them to change to specific levels. See rule <a href="#cr702.210">702.210</a>, “Mimic” and rule <a href="#cr711.9">711.9</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMinimum Deck Size">Minimum Deck Size</a></b><br>
If a rule or effect states that a player’s deck must contain at least a specific number of cards, that number is the player’s minimum deck size.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMiracle">Miracle</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets you cast a spell for a reduced cost if it’s the first card you draw in a turn. See rule <a href="#cr702.94">702.94</a>, “Miracle.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMirage">Mirage</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows certain cards to be cast for an alternative cost, but causes them to be sacrificed at the next cleanup step. See rule <a href="#cr702.163">702.163</a>, “Mirage.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosModal">Modal, Mode</a></b><br>
A spell or ability is “modal” if it has two or more options in a bulleted list preceded by instructions for a player to choose a number of those options, such as “Choose one —.” See rule <a href="#cr700.2">700.2</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosModal Double-Faced Cards">Modal Double-Faced Cards</a></b><br>
One of two kinds of double-faced cards. Modal double-faced cards can be played with either of their two faces up and can’t transform. See rule <a href="#cr712">712</a>, “Double-Faced Cards.”<br>
<br>
<b><a id="glosModified">Modified</a></b><br>
A modified creature is a creature that has a counter on it, is equipped, or is enchanted by an Aura its controller also controls. See rule <a href="#cr700.9">700.9</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosModular">Modular</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that has a permanent enter the battlefield with +1/+1 counters on it and can move those counters to other artifact creatures. See rule <a href="#cr702.43">702.43</a>, “Modular.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMonarch">Monarch</a></b><br>
A designation a player can have. Some effects instruct a player to become the monarch. The monarch draws a card at the beginning of their end step. Dealing combat damage to the monarch steals the title from that player. See rule <a href="#cr720">720</a>, “The Monarch.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMono Artifact (Obsolete)">Mono Artifact (Obsolete)</a></b><br>
An obsolete term that appeared on the type line of artifacts with activated abilities that caused the artifact to become tapped as a cost. Cards printed with this text have received errata in the Oracle card reference to simply say “Artifact,” and those abilities now include the tap symbol in their costs.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMonocolored">Monocolored</a></b><br>
An object with exactly one color is monocolored. Colorless objects aren’t monocolored. See rule <a href="#cr105">105</a>, “Colors,” and rule <a href="#cr202">202</a>, “Mana Cost and Color.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMonocolored Hybrid Mana Symbols">Monocolored Hybrid Mana Symbols</a></b><br>
See <a href="#glosHybrid Mana Symbols">Hybrid Mana Symbols</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMonstrosity">Monstrosity</a></b><br>
A keyword action that puts +1/+1 counters on a creature and makes it become monstrous. See rule <a href="#cr701.31">701.31</a>, “Monstrosity.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMonstrous">Monstrous</a></b><br>
A designation given to a creature whose ability including a monstrosity instruction has resolved. See rule <a href="#cr701.31">701.31</a>, “Monstrosity.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMonument">Monument</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows a player to cast a backface of a DFC from their graveyard. See rule C702.217.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMorph">Morph</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets a card be cast face down as a 2/2 creature. See rule <a href="#cr702.37">702.37</a>, “Morph,” and rule <a href="#cr708">708</a>, “Face-Down Spells and Permanents.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMotivate">Motivate</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that puts +1/+1 counters on a creature with lesser power when the creature with motivate enters the battlefield. See rule <a href="#cr702.164">702.164</a>, “Motivate.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMountain">Mountain</a></b><br>
One of the five basic land types. Any land with this subtype has the ability “{T}: Add {R}.” See rule <a href="#cr305.6">305.6</a>.<br>
<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMove">Move</a></b><br>
To remove a counter from one object and put it on a different object. See rule <a href="#cr122.5">122.5</a>.<br>Some older cards used “move” with respect to Auras; those cards have received errata in the Oracle card reference and now use the word “attach.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMulligan">Mulligan</a></b><br>
To take a mulligan is to reject a prospective opening hand in favor of a new one. See rule <a href="#cr103.4">103.4</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMulticolored">Multicolored</a></b><br>
An object with two or more colors is multicolored. Multicolored is not a color. See rule <a href="#cr105">105</a>, “Colors,” and rule <a href="#cr202">202</a>, “Mana Cost and Color.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMultikicker">Multikicker</a></b><br>
Multikicker is a variant of the kicker keyword ability. It represents an optional additional cost that may be paid any number of times. See rule <a href="#cr702.33">702.33</a>, “Kicker.” See also Kicker.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMultiplayer Game">Multiplayer Game</a></b><br>
A game that begins with more than two players. See <a href="#cr8">section 8</a>, “Multiplayer Rules.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMutate">Mutate</a></b><br>
A keyword that lets a creature card be cast as a mutating creature spell. See rule <a href="#cr702.140">702.140</a>, “Mutate.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMutating Creature Spell">Mutating Creature Spell</a></b><br>
A creature spell cast using the mutate keyword ability. As it resolves, if its target creature is legal, it merges with the target creature. The resulting creature has all characteristics of the topmost component and has the abilities of each component. See rule <a href="#cr702.140">702.140</a>, “Mutate,” and rule <a href="#cr723">723</a>, “Merging with Permanents.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMyriad">Myriad</a></b><br>
Myriad is a triggered ability that effectively lets a creature attack in all possible directions. See rule <a href="#cr702.116">702.116</a>, “Myriad.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosMystery">Mystery</a></b><br>
A type of card that transforms after certain conditions are met. See rule C729, “Mystery Cards.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosName">Name</a></b><br>
A characteristic, and part of a card. A card’s name is printed in its upper left corner. See rule <a href="#cr201">201</a>, “Name.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosNight">Night</a></b><br>
Along with day, a designation the game can have. See rule <a href="#cr724">724</a>, “Day and Night,” and rule <a href="#cr702.145">702.145</a>, “Daybound and Nightbound.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosNightbound">Nightbound</a></b><br>
An ability found on the back faces of some double-faced cards. Cards with daybound and nightbound are face up when it’s day and face down when it’s night. See rule <a href="#cr702.145">702.145</a>, “Daybound and Nightbound,” and rule <a href="#cr724">724</a>, “Day and Night.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosNinjutsu">Ninjutsu</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets a creature suddenly enter combat. See rule <a href="#cr702.49">702.49</a>, “Ninjutsu.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosNonbasic Land">Nonbasic Land</a></b><br>
Any land that doesn’t have the supertype “basic.” See rule <a href="#cr205.4">205.4</a>, “Supertypes.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosNontraditional Magic Card">Nontraditional Magic Card</a></b><br>
A card not included in players’ decks. It may be oversized or have a card back other than a “Deckmaster” back. See rule <a href="#cr108.2">108.2</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosNourish">Nourish</a></b><br>
A keyword action that causes a player to put +1/+1 counters on a creature or create 1/1 white Citizen creature tokens. See rule <a href="#cr701.56">701.56</a>, “Nourish.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosObject">Object</a></b><br>
An ability on the stack, a card, a copy of a card, an emblem, a token, a spell, or a permanent. See rule <a href="#cr109">109</a>, “Objects.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosOffering">Offering</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that modifies when you can cast a spell and how much mana you need to spend to do it. See rule <a href="#cr702.48">702.48</a>, “Offering.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosOne-Shot Effect">One-Shot Effect</a></b><br>
An effect that does something just once and doesn’t have a duration. See rule <a href="#cr610">610</a>, “One-Shot Effects.” See also Continuous Effects.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosOngoing">Ongoing</a></b><br>
A supertype that appears only on scheme cards. See rule <a href="#cr205.4">205.4</a>, “Supertypes.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosOpening Hand">Opening Hand</a></b><br>
The hand of cards a player starts the game with, once the player has decided not to take any further mulligans. See rule <a href="#cr103.4">103.4</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosOpponent">Opponent</a></b><br>
Someone a player is playing against. See rules <a href="#cr102.2">102.2</a> and <a href="#cr102.3">102.3</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosOption">Option</a></b><br>
An additional rule or set of rules that can be used in a multiplayer game. See rule <a href="#cr800.2">800.2</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosOracle">Oracle</a></b><br>
The reference that contains the up-to-date wordings (in English) for all tournament-legal cards. A card’s Oracle text can be found using the Gatherer card database at Gatherer.Wizards.com. See rule <a href="#cr108.1">108.1</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosOrchestrate">Orchestrate</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that provides an alternate way to cast a card, exiling it and casting it for free the next time its controller casts a spell. See rule <a href="#cr702.182">702.182</a>, “Orchestrate.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosOutlast">Outlast</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows a creature to grow larger over time. See rule <a href="#cr702.107">702.107</a>, “Outlast.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosOutside the Game">Outside the Game</a></b><br>
An object is “outside the game” if it isn’t in any of the game’s zones. See rule <a href="#cr400.11">400.11</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosOverclock">Overclock</a></b><br>
An ability that makes an artifact better by having a creature overclock it. See rule C702.220 “Overclock.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosOverload">Overload</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows a spell to affect either a single target or many objects. See rule <a href="#cr702.96">702.96</a>, “Overload.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosOwner">Owner</a></b><br>
The player who (for purposes of the game) a card, permanent, token, or spell belongs to. See rules <a href="#cr108.3">108.3</a>, 110.2, 111.2, and <a href="#cr112.2">112.2</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPage Cards">Page Cards</a></b><br>
A card frame that contains a smaller inset card. See rule <a href="#cr716">716</a>, “Page Cards.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPaired">Paired</a></b><br>
A term that describes a creature that’s been affected by a soulbond ability. See rule <a href="#cr702.95">702.95</a>, “Soulbond.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosParanoia">Paranoia</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows certain spells to be cast for an alternative cost when a permanent leaves the battlefield. See rule <a href="#cr702.173">702.173</a>, “Paranoia.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosParis Mulligan">Paris Mulligan</a></b><br>
Informal term for a previous system of taking a mulligan. Using the Paris mulligan, a player who took a mulligan shuffled their hand into their library and drew one fewer card. For current mulligan rules, see rule <a href="#cr103.4">103.4</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPartner">Partner, Partner with [name]</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets two legendary creatures or planeswalkers be your commander in the Commander variant rather than one. “Partner with [name]” is a specialized version of the ability that works even outside of the Commander variant to help two cards reach the battlefield together. See rule <a href="#cr702.124">702.124</a>, “Partner,” and rule <a href="#cr903">903</a>, “Commander.”<br>
<br>
<b><a id="glosParty">Party</a></b><br>
Some cards refer to the number of creatures in your party. A player’s party includes up to one each of Cleric, Rogue, Warrior, and Wizard. See rule <a href="#cr700.8">700.8</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPass">Pass</a></b><br>
To decline to take any action (such as casting a spell or activating an ability) when you have priority. See rule <a href="#cr117">117</a>, “Timing and Priority.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPass in Succession">Pass in Succession</a></b><br>
All players “pass in succession” if each player in the game (starting with any one of them) opts not to take an action upon receiving priority. See rule <a href="#cr117">117</a>, “Timing and Priority.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPay">Pay</a></b><br>
To perform the actions required by a cost. This often means, but is not restricted to, spending resources such as mana or life. See rule <a href="#cr118">118</a>, “Costs.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPerennial trigger">Perennial trigger</a></b><br>
A type of trigger that only gives an effect a limited number of times each turn, after which it stops triggering for the turn. See rule <a href="#cr603.13">603.13</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPermanent">Permanent</a></b><br>
A card or token on the battlefield. See rule <a href="#cr110">110</a>, “Permanents.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPermanent Card">Permanent Card</a></b><br>
A card that could be put onto the battlefield. See rule <a href="#cr110.4a">110.4a</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPermanent Spell">Permanent Spell</a></b><br>
A spell that will enter the battlefield as a permanent as part of its resolution. See rule <a href="#cr110.4b">110.4b</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPermanently (Obsolete)">Permanently (Obsolete)</a></b><br>
An obsolete term used to indicate that a continuous effect has no duration and thus lasts until the end of the game. Cards printed with this term have received errata in the Oracle card reference to delete it.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPermutate">Permutate</a></b><br>
A keyword action that allows you to remove a counter from a creature to put two +1/+1 counters on a different creature. See rule <a href="#cr701.68">701.68</a>, “Permutate.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPersevere">Persevere</a></b><br>
After a creature survives damage, it perseveres. See rule <a href="#cr700.10">700.10</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPersist">Persist</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that can return a creature from the graveyard to the battlefield. See rule <a href="#cr702.79">702.79</a>, “Persist.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPhase">Phase</a></b><br>
1. A subsection of a turn. See <a href="#cr5">section 5</a>, “Turn Structure.”<br>2. A permanent “phases in” when its status changes from phased out to phased in. A permanent “phases out” when its status changes from phased in to phased out. See rule <a href="#cr702.26">702.26</a>, “Phasing.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPhased In">Phased In, Phased Out</a></b><br>
A status a permanent may have. Phased-in is the default status. Phased-out permanents are treated as though they do not exist. See rule <a href="#cr110.5">110.5</a> and rule <a href="#cr702.26">702.26</a>, “Phasing.” (“Phased-out” was a zone in older versions of the rules.)<br>
<br>
<b><a id="glosPhasing">Phasing</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that causes a permanent to sometimes be treated as though it does not exist. See rule <a href="#cr702.26">702.26</a>, “Phasing.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPhenomenon">Phenomenon</a></b><br>
A card type seen only on nontraditional Magic cards in the Planechase casual variant. A phenomenon card is not a permanent. See rule <a href="#cr311">311</a>, “Phenomena.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPhyrexian Mana Symbol">Phyrexian Mana Symbol</a></b><br>
A mana symbol that represents a cost that can be paid either by spending colored mana or by paying life. See rule <a href="#cr107.4">107.4</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPhyrexian Symbol">Phyrexian Symbol</a></b><br>
A symbol used in rules text to represent any of the five Phyrexian mana symbols. See rule <a href="#cr107.4g">107.4g</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPile">Pile</a></b><br>
A temporary grouping of cards. See rule <a href="#cr700.3">700.3</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPlaced">Placed</a></b><br>
(Obsolete) Some spells and abilities previously referred to a counter being “placed” on a permanent. These cards have received errata in the Oracle card reference to use the term “put” instead. Due to a rules change, these cards continue to function as they did before. See rule <a href="#cr122">122</a>, “Counters.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPlains">Plains</a></b><br>
One of the five basic land types. Any land with this subtype has the ability “{T}: Add {W}.” See rule <a href="#cr305.6">305.6</a>.<br>
<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPlanar Deck">Planar Deck</a></b><br>
A deck of at least ten plane cards needed to play the Planechase casual variant. See rule <a href="#cr901.3">901.3</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPlanar Die">Planar Die</a></b><br>
A specialized six-sided die needed to play the Planechase casual variant. See rule <a href="#cr901.3">901.3</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPlane">Plane</a></b><br>
A card type seen only on nontraditional Magic cards in the Planechase casual variant. A plane card is not a permanent. See rule <a href="#cr310">310</a>, “Planes.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPlanechase">Planechase</a></b><br>
A casual variant in which plane cards and phenomenon cards add additional abilities and randomness to the game. See rule <a href="#cr901">901</a>, “Planechase.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPlaneswalk">Planeswalk</a></b><br>
To put each face-up plane card or phenomenon card on the bottom of its owner’s planar deck face down, then move the top card of your planar deck off that planar deck and turn it face up in a Planechase game. See rule <a href="#cr701.24">701.24</a>, “Planeswalk.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPlaneswalker">Planeswalker</a></b><br>
A card type. A planeswalker is a permanent. See rule <a href="#cr306">306</a>, “Planeswalkers.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPlaneswalker Symbol">Planeswalker Symbol</a></b><br>
The Planeswalker symbol {PW} appears on the planar die in the Planechase casual variant. See rule <a href="#cr107.11">107.11</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPlaneswalker Type">Planeswalker Type</a></b><br>
A subtype that’s correlated to the planeswalker card type. See rule <a href="#cr306">306</a>, “Planeswalkers.” See rule <a href="#cr205.3n">205.3n</a> for the list of planeswalker types.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPlaneswalker Uniqueness Rule (Obsolete)">Planeswalker Uniqueness Rule (Obsolete)</a></b><br>
Older versions of the rules stated that a player who controlled two or more planeswalkers with the same planeswalker type would put all but one of those planeswalkers into their owners’ graveyards. This rule was called the “planeswalker uniqueness rule” and no longer exists.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPlaneswalker fight">Planeswalker fight</a></b><br>
If a noncreature planeswalker would fight, it deals damage equal to its loyalty rather than its power. See rule <a href="#cr701.12">701.12</a>, “Fight.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPlay">Play</a></b><br>
1. To play a land is to put a land onto the battlefield as a special action. See rule <a href="#cr116">116</a>, “Special Actions,” and rule <a href="#cr305">305</a>, “Lands.”<br>2. To play a card is to play that card as a land or cast that card as a spell, whichever is appropriate. See rule <a href="#cr601">601</a>, “Casting Spells.”<br>3. (Obsolete) Casting a spell used to be known as playing a spell. Cards with that text have received errata in the Oracle card reference. See Cast.<br>4. (Obsolete) Activating an activated ability used to be known as playing an activated ability. Cards with that text have received errata in the Oracle card reference. See Activate.<br>5. (Obsolete) The battlefield used to be known as the in-play zone. Cards that were printed with text that contains the phrases “in play,” “from play,” “into play,” or the like are referring to the battlefield and have received errata in the Oracle card reference. See Battlefield.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPlayer">Player</a></b><br>
One of the people in the game. See rule <a href="#cr102">102</a>, “Players.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPoison Counter">Poison Counter</a></b><br>
A counter that may be given to a player. See rule <a href="#cr122">122</a>, “Counters,” and rule <a href="#cr704.5c">704.5c</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPoisoned">Poisoned</a></b><br>
Having one or more poison counters. See rule <a href="#cr122">122</a>, “Counters.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPoisonous">Poisonous</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that causes a player to get poison counters. See rule <a href="#cr702.70">702.70</a>, “Poisonous.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPoly Artifact (Obsolete)">Poly Artifact (Obsolete)</a></b><br>
An obsolete term that appeared on the type line of artifacts with activated abilities that didn’t cause the artifact to be tapped as a cost. Cards printed with this text have received errata in the Oracle card reference to simply say “Artifact.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPopulate">Populate</a></b><br>
A keyword action that creates a copy of a creature token you control. See rule <a href="#cr701.30">701.30</a>, “Populate.”<br>
