<br><b><a id="glosPost a bounty">Post a bounty, bounty</a></b><br>
A keyword action that puts a bounty counter on a permanent, letting its controller's opponents draw a card when it dies. See rule <a href="#cr701.54">701.54</a>, “Post a bounty.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPostcombat Main Phase">Postcombat Main Phase</a></b><br>
A main phase that occurs after a combat phase. See Main Phase.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPower">Power</a></b><br>
1. Part of a card that only creatures have. A creature card’s power is printed before the slash in its lower right corner. See rule <a href="#cr208">208</a>, “Power/Toughness.”<br>2. A characteristic that only creatures have. See rule <a href="#cr302.4">302.4</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPrecombat Main Phase">Precombat Main Phase</a></b><br>
The first main phase of a turn. See Main Phase.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPressure">Pressure</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows certain spells to be cast for an alternative cost while you have seven or more cards in your graveyard. See rule <a href="#cr702.207">702.207</a>, “Pressure.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPrevent">Prevent</a></b><br>
A word used by prevention effects to indicate what damage will not be dealt. See rule <a href="#cr615">615</a>, “Prevention Effects.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPrevention Effect">Prevention Effect</a></b><br>
A kind of continuous effect that watches for a damage event that would happen and completely or partially prevents the damage that would be dealt. See rule <a href="#cr615">615</a>, “Prevention Effects.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPrimal">Primal</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows certiain cards to be cast for an alternative cost by skipping a land drop.See rule <a href="#cr702.176">702.176</a>, “Primal.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPriority">Priority</a></b><br>
Which player can take actions at any given time is determined by a system of “priority.” See rule <a href="#cr117">117</a>, “Timing and Priority.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosProfit">Profit</a></b><br>
A keyword action that causes a player to create a Gold token. See rule <a href="#cr701.62">701.62</a>, “Profit.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosProject">Project</a></b><br>
A variant of leveler cards that use progress counters intead of level counters.  See rule C711.8.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosProliferate">Proliferate</a></b><br>
To give an additional counter to any number of players and/or permanents of each kind they already have. See rule <a href="#cr701.27">701.27</a>, “Proliferate.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosProphecy">Prophecy</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that exiles certain cards and allows them to be cast afterwards as they are revealed. See rule <a href="#cr702.165">702.165</a>, “Prophecy.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosProtection">Protection</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that provides a range of benefits against objects with a specific quality. See rule <a href="#cr702.16">702.16</a>, “Protection.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosProvoke">Provoke</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that can force a creature to block. See rule <a href="#cr702.39">702.39</a>, “Provoke.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosProwess">Prowess</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that causes a creature to get +1/+1 whenever its controller casts a noncreature spell. See rule <a href="#cr702.108">702.108</a>, “Prowess.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosProwl">Prowl</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that may allow a spell to be cast for an alternative cost. See rule <a href="#cr702.76">702.76</a>, “Prowl.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPublic Zone">Public Zone</a></b><br>
A zone in which all players can be expected to see the cards’ faces. See rule <a href="#cr400.2">400.2</a>. See also Hidden Zone.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPurge">Purge</a></b><br>
A keyword action that allows a player to exile two cards that share a type from graveyards to draw a card. See rule <a href="#cr701.52">701.52</a>, “Purge.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosPuzzlebox">Puzzlebox</a></b><br>
A keyword ability of conspiracies that allow you to unlock cards later in the game. See rule <a href="#cr702.187">702.187</a>, “Puzzlebox.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosQuest">Quest</a></b><br>
A type of card that triggers certain abilities whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control. See rule V731, “Quest Cards.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosQuickdraw">Quickdraw</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows certain cards to be cast for an alternative cost when a creature is blocked or blocks. See rule <a href="#cr702.178">702.178</a>, “Quickdraw.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosRampage">Rampage</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that can make a creature better in combat. See rule <a href="#cr702.23">702.23</a>, “Rampage.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosRange of Influence">Range of Influence</a></b><br>
See <a href="#glosLimited Range of Influence">Limited Range of Influence</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosReach">Reach</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows a creature to block an attacking creature with flying. See rule <a href="#cr702.17">702.17</a>, “Reach.” See also Flying.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosRealm">Realm</a></b><br>
A type of cards that unlocks a permanent effect after activating a number of abilities. See rule C730, “Realm Cards.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosReappropriate">Reappropriate</a></b><br>
A keyword action where a player exiles exactly two cards from their hand and/or graveyard. See rule <a href="#cr701.65">701.65</a>, “Reappropriate.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosRebound">Rebound</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows an instant or sorcery spell to be cast a second time. See rule <a href="#cr702.88">702.88</a>, “Rebound.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosRecite">Recite</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows a creature to be cast from a graveyard, and then be immediately exiled. See rule <a href="#cr702.183">702.183</a>, “Recite.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosReconfigure">Reconfigure</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows an Equipment creature to temporarily stop being a creature and become attached to another creature. See rule <a href="#cr702.151">702.151</a>, “Reconfigure.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosRecover">Recover</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets a player return a card from their graveyard to their hand. See rule <a href="#cr702.59">702.59</a>, “Recover.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosRecruit">Recruit</a></b><br>
A keyword action that creates a 0/0 Solider Army, then puts a +1/+1 counter on each Army that player controls. See rule C701.76<br>
<br><b><a id="glosRedirect (Obsolete)">Redirect (Obsolete)</a></b><br>
Some older cards were printed with the term “redirect” to indicate a redirection effect. Such cards have received errata in the Oracle card reference so they explicitly state that damage that would be dealt to one object or player is dealt “instead” to another. See Redirection Effect.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosRedirection Effect">Redirection Effect</a></b><br>
A kind of replacement effect that causes damage that would be dealt to one creature, planeswalker, or player to be dealt instead to another creature, planeswalker, or player. See rule <a href="#cr614.9">614.9</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosRediscover">Rediscover</a></b><br>
A keyword action that allows a player to draw a card if its of a particular quality. See rule, 701.66, “Rediscover.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosReflexive Triggered Ability">Reflexive Triggered Ability</a></b><br>
An ability that triggers based on actions taken earlier during a spell or ability’s resolution. See rule <a href="#cr603.12">603.12</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosRegenerate">Regenerate</a></b><br>
To replace a permanent’s destruction with an alternate sequence of events. See rule <a href="#cr701.15">701.15</a>, “Regenerate.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosReinforce">Reinforce</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets a player put +1/+1 counters on a creature. See rule <a href="#cr702.77">702.77</a>, “Reinforce.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosReminder Text">Reminder Text</a></b><br>
Parenthetical text in italics in the text box of a card that summarizes a rule that applies to that card, but is not actually rules text and has no effect on play. See rule <a href="#cr207.2">207.2</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosRemove from the Game">Remove from the Game, Removed, Removed-from-the-Game Zone (Obsolete)</a></b><br>
“Remove [something] from the game” is an obsolete term for “exile [something].” “The removed card” is an obsolete term for “the exiled card.” The removed-from-the-game zone is an obsolete term for the exile zone. Cards with that text have received errata in the Oracle card reference. See Exile.<br>
<br>
<b><a id="glosRemoved from Combat">Removed from Combat</a></b><br>
Certain events can cause an attacking or blocking creature, or a planeswalker that’s being attacked, to be “removed from combat.” A permanent that’s removed from combat has no further involvement in that combat phase. See rule <a href="#cr506.4">506.4</a>.<br>
<br>
<b><a id="glosRenown">Renown</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that makes a creature stronger after it deals combat damage to a player. See rule <a href="#cr702.112">702.112</a>, “Renown.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosRenowned">Renowned</a></b><br>
A designation given to a permanent as a result of the renown ability. See rule <a href="#cr702.112">702.112</a>, “Renown.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosReplacement Effect">Replacement Effect</a></b><br>
A kind of continuous effect that watches for a particular event that would happen and completely or partially replaces that event with a different event. See rule <a href="#cr614">614</a>, “Replacement Effects.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosReplicate">Replicate</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that creates copies of a spell. See rule <a href="#cr702.56">702.56</a>, “Replicate.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosReprise">Reprise</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows certain cards in graveyard add their effects to a spell being cast. See rule <a href="#cr702.166">702.166</a>, “Reprise.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosRequirement">Requirement</a></b><br>
An effect that forces one or more creatures to attack or block. See rules <a href="#cr508.1d">508.1d</a> and <a href="#cr509.1c">509.1c</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosResolve">Resolve</a></b><br>
When the spell or ability on top of the stack “resolves,” its instructions are followed and it has its effect. See rule <a href="#cr608">608</a>, “Resolving Spells and Abilities.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosRespawn">Respawn</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that brings a creature back to your hand if it dies after attacking. See rule <a href="#cr702.212">702.212</a>, “Respawn.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosRespond">Respond</a></b><br>
To cast an instant spell or activate an ability while another spell or ability is already on the stack. See rule <a href="#cr117.7">117.7</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosRestart the Game">Restart the Game</a></b><br>
To immediately end the current game and restart it. See rule <a href="#cr104">104</a>, “Ending the Game.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosRestriction">Restriction</a></b><br>
An effect that precludes one or more creatures from attacking or blocking. See rules <a href="#cr508.1c">508.1c</a> and <a href="#cr509.1b">509.1b</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosRetrace">Retrace</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets a player cast a card from their graveyard. See rule <a href="#cr702.81">702.81</a>, “Retrace.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosReveal">Reveal</a></b><br>
To show a card to all players for a brief time. See rule <a href="#cr701.16">701.16</a>, “Reveal.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosReverberate">Reverberate</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows certain spells to be copied once by paying an additional cost. See rule <a href="#cr702.167">702.167</a>, “Reverberate.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosRevive">Revive</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that creates a token copy of certain cards in graveyards. See rule <a href="#cr702.168">702.168</a>, “Revive.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosRiddle">Riddle</a></b><br>
A supertype that has no rules meaning, but denotes a card that poses a challenge of how to utilize it.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosRide">Ride</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that transforms a card into a Mount Aura, which transforms back when it is no longer attached or a cost is paid. See rule <a href="#cr702.223">702.223</a>, “Ride.”<br>
<br>
<b><a id="glosRiot">Riot</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets a player choose whether certain creatures enter the battlefield with haste or with a +1/+1 counter. See rule <a href="#cr702.136">702.136</a>, “Riot.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosRipple">Ripple</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that may let a player cast extra cards from their library for no cost. See rule <a href="#cr702.60">702.60</a>, “Ripple.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosRoll a d20">Roll a d20</a></b><br>
To roll a twenty-sided die. Similarly, a d4 is a four-sided die, a d6 is a six-sided die, and so on. See rule <a href="#cr706">706</a>, “Rolling a Die.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosRoom">Room</a></b><br>
A subsection of a dungeon card. See rule <a href="#cr309">309</a>, “Dungeons.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosRoom Ability">Room Ability</a></b><br>
A triggered ability that triggers whenever a player moves their venture marker into a room of a dungeon card. See rule <a href="#cr309">309</a>, “Dungeons.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosRules Text">Rules Text</a></b><br>
A characteristic that defines a card’s abilities. See rule <a href="#cr207.1">207.1</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSacrifice">Sacrifice</a></b><br>
To move a permanent you control to its owner’s graveyard. See rule <a href="#cr701.17">701.17</a>, “Sacrifice.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSaga">Saga</a></b><br>
An enchantment subtype. Sagas have a number of chapter abilities that take effect over a number of turns to tell a story. See rule <a href="#cr715">715</a>, “Saga Cards.” <br>
<br><b><a id="glosSalvage">Salvage</a></b><br>
A keyword action that exiles a card until the salvaging creature leaves the battlefield, then returns one of those cards to your hand when that creature deals combat damage. See rule <a href="#cr701.71">701.71</a>, “Salvage.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosScavenge">Scavenge</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows you to exile a creature card from your graveyard to put +1/+1 counters on a creature. See rule <a href="#cr702.97">702.97</a>, “Scavenge.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosScheme">Scheme</a></b><br>
A card type seen only on nontraditional Magic cards in the Archenemy casual variant. A scheme card is not a permanent. See rule <a href="#cr313">313</a>, “Schemes.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosScry">Scry</a></b><br>
To manipulate some of the cards on top of your library. See rule <a href="#cr701.18">701.18</a>, “Scry.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSearch">Search</a></b><br>
To look at all cards in a stated zone and possibly find a card that matches a given description. See rule <a href="#cr701.19">701.19</a>, “Search.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSecondary Title Bar">Secondary Title Bar</a></b><br>
A smaller name line with the Oracle reference name of a card which has an alternate name in its upper left corner. See rule <a href="#cr201.6">201.6</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSet Aside (Obsolete)">Set Aside (Obsolete)</a></b><br>
“Set [something] aside” is an obsolete term for “exile [something].” Cards with that text have received errata in the Oracle card reference. See Exile.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSet in Motion">Set in Motion</a></b><br>
To move a scheme card off the top of your scheme deck and turn it face up. See rule <a href="#cr701.25">701.25</a>, “Set in Motion.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosShadow">Shadow</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that restricts how a creature may be blocked and which creatures it can block. See rule <a href="#cr702.28">702.28</a>, “Shadow.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosShard Token">Shard Token</a></b><br>
A Shard token is a colorless enchantment token with “{2}, Sacrifice this enchantment: Scry 1, then draw a card.” For more information on predefined tokens, see rule <a href="#cr111.10">111.10</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosShared Life Total">Shared Life Total</a></b><br>
In the Two-Headed Giant multiplayer variant, each team has a “shared life total” rather than each player having an individual life total. See rule <a href="#cr810">810</a>, “Two-Headed Giant Variant.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosShared Team Turns Option">Shared Team Turns Option</a></b><br>
An option that may be used in certain multiplayer variants, such as Two-Headed Giant and Archenemy. See rule <a href="#cr805">805</a>, “Shared Team Turns Option.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosShield Counter">Shield Counter</a></b><br>
A counter that protects a permanent from being damaged or destroyed. See rule <a href="#cr122.1c">122.1c</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosShimmer">Shimmer</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that creates an attacking token copy of a creature when it attacks, which is exiled at end of turn. See rule <a href="#cr702.169">702.169</a>, “Shimmer.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosShortcut">Shortcut</a></b><br>
A mutually understood way for the game to advance forward a number of game choices (either taking an action or passing priority) without players needing to explicitly identify each such choice. See rule <a href="#cr725">725</a>, “Taking Shortcuts.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosShroud">Shroud</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that precludes a permanent or player from being targeted. See rule <a href="#cr702.18">702.18</a>, “Shroud.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosShuffle">Shuffle</a></b><br>
To randomize the cards in a deck (before a game) or library (during a game). See rule <a href="#cr103.2">103.2</a> and rule <a href="#cr701.20">701.20</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSideboard">Sideboard</a></b><br>
Extra cards that may be used to modify a deck between games of a match. See rules <a href="#cr100.4">100.4</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSilver-Bordered">Silver-Bordered</a></b><br>
Cards in certain sets and certain promotional cards are printed with a silver border. Silver-bordered cards are intended for casual play and may have features and text that aren’t covered by these rules.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSimulacrum">Simulacrum</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that creates a 1/1 copy of a creature when it dies. See rule C702.221 “Simulacrum.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSkip">Skip</a></b><br>
Effects that use the word “skip” are replacement effects. The word “skip” indicates what events, steps, phases, or turns will be replaced with nothing. See rule <a href="#cr614">614</a>, “Replacement Effects.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSkulk">Skulk</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that restricts how a creature may be blocked. See rule <a href="#cr702.118">702.118</a>, “Skulk.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSleight">Sleight</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows certain spells to be cast as though they had flash for {1} more. See rule <a href="#cr702.188">702.188</a>, “Sleight.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSlipstream">Slipstream</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that makes a creature unable to be blocked if only slipstream creatures are attacking. See rule <a href="#cr702.208">702.208</a>, “Slipstream.”<br>
<br>
<b><a id="glosSnow">Snow</a></b><br>
A supertype that’s normally relevant on permanents. See rule <a href="#cr205.4">205.4</a>, “Supertypes.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSnow Mana Symbol">Snow Mana Symbol</a></b><br>
The snow mana symbol {S} represents a cost that can be paid with one mana produced by a snow source. It can also represent mana from a snow source that was spent to pay a cost. See rule <a href="#cr107.4h">107.4h</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSnow-Covered (Obsolete)">Snow-Covered (Obsolete)</a></b><br>
Some older cards were printed with the term “snow-covered” in their rules text. Except when referencing card names, such cards have received errata in the Oracle card reference to reference the supertype “snow” instead. See Snow.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSoar">Soar</a></b><br>
A keyword action that causes the soaring creature to get a flying counter or a +1/+1 counter. See rule <a href="#cr701.77">701.77</a>, “Soar.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSorcery">Sorcery</a></b><br>
A card type. A sorcery is not a permanent. See rule <a href="#cr307">307</a>, “Sorceries.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSoulbond">Soulbond</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that makes creatures better by pairing them together. See rule <a href="#cr702.95">702.95</a>, “Soulbond.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSoulshift">Soulshift</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets a player return a card from their graveyard to their hand. See rule <a href="#cr702.46">702.46</a>, “Soulshift.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSource of Damage">Source of Damage</a></b><br>
The object that dealt that damage. See rule <a href="#cr609.7">609.7</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSource of Mana">Source of Mana</a></b><br>
The spell that produced mana or the source of the ability that produced mana. See rule <a href="#cr106.3">106.3</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSource of an Ability">Source of an Ability</a></b><br>
The object that generated that ability. See rule <a href="#cr113.7">113.7</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSpecial Action">Special Action</a></b><br>
An action a player may take that doesn’t use the stack. See rule <a href="#cr116">116</a>, “Special Actions.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSpectacle">Spectacle</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows certain spells to be cast for an alternative cost if an opponent has lost life. See rule <a href="#cr702.137">702.137</a>, “Spectacle.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSpell">Spell</a></b><br>
A card on the stack. Also a copy (of either a card or another spell) on the stack. See rule <a href="#cr112">112</a>, “Spells.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSpell Ability">Spell Ability</a></b><br>
A kind of ability. Spell abilities are abilities that are followed as instructions while an instant or sorcery spell is resolving. See rule <a href="#cr113.3a">113.3a</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSpell Type">Spell Type</a></b><br>
A subtype that’s correlated to the instant card type and the sorcery card type. See rule <a href="#cr304">304</a>, “Instants,” and rule <a href="#cr307">307</a>, “Sorceries.” See rule <a href="#cr205.3q">205.3q</a> for the list of spell types.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSpirited">Spirited</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows a creature to activate one of its abilities for free when it enters the battlefield. See rule <a href="#cr702.184">702.184</a>, “Spirited.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSplice">Splice</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets a player add a card’s rules text onto another spell. See rule <a href="#cr702.47">702.47</a>, “Splice.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSplit Cards">Split Cards</a></b><br>
Cards with two card faces on a single card. See rule <a href="#cr709">709</a>, “Split Cards.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSplit Second">Split Second</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that makes it nearly impossible for a player to respond to a spell. See rule <a href="#cr702.61">702.61</a>, “Split Second.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosStack">Stack</a></b><br>
A zone. The stack is the zone in which spells, activated abilities, and triggered abilities wait to resolve. See rule <a href="#cr405">405</a>, “Stack.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosStarting Deck">Starting Deck</a></b><br>
After a player has set aside their sideboard, their remaining deck becomes their starting deck. See rule <a href="#cr103.2">103.2</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosStarting Hand Size">Starting Hand Size</a></b><br>
The number of cards a player draws as a game begins. In most games, each player’s starting hand size is seven. See rule <a href="#cr103.4">103.4</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosStarting Life Total">Starting Life Total</a></b><br>
The amount of life a player has as a game begins. In most games, each player’s starting life total is 20. See rule <a href="#cr103.3">103.3</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosStarting Player">Starting Player</a></b><br>
The player chosen to take the first turn of a game. See rule <a href="#cr103.1">103.1</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosStarting Team">Starting Team</a></b><br>
The team chosen to take the first turn of a game using the shared team turns option. See rule <a href="#cr103.1">103.1</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosState Trigger">State Trigger</a></b><br>
A triggered ability that triggers when a game state is true rather than triggering when an event occurs. See rule <a href="#cr603.8">603.8</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosState-Based Actions">State-Based Actions</a></b><br>
Game actions that happen automatically whenever certain conditions are met. See rule <a href="#cr704">704</a>, “State-Based Actions.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosStatic Ability">Static Ability</a></b><br>
A kind of ability. Static abilities do something all the time rather than being activated or triggered. See rule <a href="#cr113">113</a>, “Abilities,” and rule <a href="#cr604">604</a>, “Handling Static Abilities.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosStatus">Status</a></b><br>
The physical state of a permanent. See rule <a href="#cr110.5">110.5</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosStep">Step</a></b><br>
A subsection of a phase. See <a href="#cr5">section 5</a>, “Turn Structure.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosStoried">Storied</a></b><br>
An object is storied if it is legendary or an enchantment. See rule <a href="#cr700.12">700.12</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosStorm">Storm</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that creates copies of a spell. See rule <a href="#cr702.40">702.40</a>, “Storm.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSubgame">Subgame</a></b><br>
A completely separate Magic game created by an effect. See rule <a href="#cr722">722</a>, “Subgames.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSubmerge">Submerge</a></b><br>
A keyword action that exiles a card, then puts it onto the battlefield face-down as a 2/2 creature. See rule <a href="#cr701.53">701.53</a>, “Submerge.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSubstantiate">Substantiate</a></b><br>
A keyword action that puts a card onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature, and allows the spell to be cast afterwards if the card isn't a creature. See rule <a href="#cr701.63">701.63</a>, “Substantiate.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSubstitute Card">Substitute Card</a></b><br>
A game supplement with a Magic card back that can be used to represent a double-faced card or meld card. See rule <a href="#cr714">714</a>, “Substitute Cards.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSubtype">Subtype</a></b><br>
A characteristic that appears after the card type and a long dash on a card’s type line. See rule <a href="#cr205.3">205.3</a>, “Subtypes.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSuccessfully Cast (Obsolete)">Successfully Cast (Obsolete)</a></b><br>
A term that was printed on some older cards. In general, cards that referred to a spell being “successfully cast” have received errata in the Oracle card reference to simply refer to a spell being “cast.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSuccessor">Successor</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that creates a 1/1 token copy of certain cards in graveyards. See rule <a href="#cr702.218">702.218</a>, “Successor.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSummon (Obsolete)">Summon (Obsolete)</a></b><br>
Older creature cards were printed with “Summon [creature type]” on their type lines. All such cards have received errata in the Oracle card reference to say “Creature — [creature type].” (Many of these cards’ creature types have also been updated.) See Creature.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSummoning Sickness Rule">Summoning Sickness Rule</a></b><br>
Informal term for a player’s inability to attack with a creature or to activate its abilities that include the tap symbol or the untap symbol unless the creature has been under that player’s control since the beginning of that player’s most recent turn. See rule <a href="#cr302.6">302.6</a>. See also Haste.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSunburst">Sunburst</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that can have a permanent enter the battlefield with +1/+1 counters or charge counters on it. See rule <a href="#cr702.44">702.44</a>, “Sunburst.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSupertype">Supertype</a></b><br>
A characteristic that appears before the card type on a card’s type line. Most cards don’t have a supertype. See rule <a href="#cr205.4">205.4</a>, “Supertypes.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSupervillain Rumble">Supervillain Rumble</a></b><br>
A Free-for-All game in which each player is an archenemy. See rule <a href="#cr806">806</a>, “Free-for-All,” and rule <a href="#cr904">904</a>, “Archenemy.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSupport">Support</a></b><br>
A keyword action that lets you put +1/+1 counters on creatures. See rule <a href="#cr701.35">701.35</a>, “Support.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSurge">Surge</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that provides an alternative cost to cast a card if you or one of your teammates has cast another spell in the same turn. See rule <a href="#cr702.117">702.117</a>, “Surge.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSurveil">Surveil</a></b><br>
To manipulate some of the cards on top of your library, sending some of them to your graveyard and rearranging the rest. See rule <a href="#cr701.42">701.42</a>, “Surveil.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSuspend">Suspend</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that provides an alternative way to play a card. See rule <a href="#cr702.62">702.62</a>, “Suspend.” A card is “suspended” if it’s in the exile zone, has suspend, and has a time counter on it.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosSwamp">Swamp</a></b><br>
One of the five basic land types. Any land with this subtype has the ability “{T}: Add {B}.” See rule <a href="#cr305.6">305.6</a>.<br>
<br>
<br><b><a id="glosTale">Tale</a></b><br>
Cards with a two-part card frame, where a copy of the Tale spell may be cast once while the permanent with the Tale is on the battlefield. See rule <a href="#cr716.6">716.6</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosTap">Tap</a></b><br>
To turn a permanent sideways from an upright position. See rule <a href="#cr701.21">701.21</a>, “Tap and Untap.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosTap Symbol">Tap Symbol</a></b><br>
The tap symbol {T} in an activation cost means “Tap this permanent.” See rule <a href="#cr107.5">107.5</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosTapped">Tapped</a></b><br>
A status a permanent may have. See rule <a href="#cr110.5">110.5</a> and rule <a href="#cr701.21">701.21</a>, “Tap and Untap.” See also Untapped.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosTarget">Target</a></b><br>
A preselected object or player a spell or ability will affect. See rule <a href="#cr115">115</a>, “Targets.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosTeam">Team</a></b><br>
A group of players who share a common victory condition in a multiplayer game. See rule <a href="#cr808">808</a>, “Team vs. Team Variant,” rule <a href="#cr809">809</a>, “Emperor Variant,” rule <a href="#cr810">810</a>, “Two-Headed Giant Variant,” and rule <a href="#cr811">811</a>, “Alternating Teams Variant.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosTeam vs. Team Variant">Team vs. Team Variant</a></b><br>
A multiplayer variant played among two or more teams, each of which sits together. See rule <a href="#cr808">808</a>, “Team vs. Team Variant.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosTeammate">Teammate</a></b><br>
In a multiplayer game between teams, a player’s teammates are the other players on their team. See rule <a href="#cr102.3">102.3</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosTether">Tether</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows an instant or sorcery spell to be cast a second time after a creature dies. See rule <a href="#cr702.203">702.203</a>, “Tether.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosText Box">Text Box</a></b><br>
Part of a card. The text box is printed on the lower half of the card and contains the card’s rules text, reminder text, and flavor text. See rule <a href="#cr207">207</a>, “Text Box.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosText-Changing Effect">Text-Changing Effect</a></b><br>
A continuous effect that changes the text that appears in an object’s text box and/or type line. See rule <a href="#cr612">612</a>, “Text-Changing Effects.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosThreshold">Threshold</a></b><br>
“Threshold” used to be a keyword ability. It is now an ability word and has no rules meaning. All cards printed with the threshold keyword have received errata in the Oracle card reference.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosTimestamp Order">Timestamp Order</a></b><br>
A system used to determine in which order continuous effects in the same layer or sublayer are applied. See rule <a href="#cr613.7">613.7</a>. See also Dependency.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosTithe">Tithe</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows three artifacts and/or creatures to be tapped for some effect. See rule <a href="#cr702.197">702.197</a>, “Tithe.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosToken">Token</a></b><br>
A marker used to represent any permanent that isn’t represented by a card. See rule <a href="#cr111">111</a>, “Tokens.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosTombstone Icon">Tombstone Icon</a></b><br>
An icon that appears in the upper left of some Odyssey block cards that has no effect on game play. See rule <a href="#cr107.9">107.9</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosTorment">Torment</a></b><br>
A keyword action that causes a player to lose 3 life unless they discard a card or sacrifice a nonland permanent. See rule <a href="#cr701.67">701.67</a>, “Torment.”<br>
<br>
<b><a id="glosTotal Cost">Total Cost</a></b><br>
What a player actually has to pay, in practical terms, to cast a spell or activated ability: the mana cost, activation cost, or alternative cost, plus all cost increases (including additional costs) and minus all cost reductions. See rule <a href="#cr601.2f">601.2f</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosTotem Armor">Totem Armor</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows an Aura to protect the permanent it’s enchanting. See rule <a href="#cr702.89">702.89</a>, “Totem Armor.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosToughness">Toughness</a></b><br>
1. Part of a card that only creatures have. A creature card’s toughness is printed after the slash in its lower right corner. See rule <a href="#cr208">208</a>, “Power/Toughness.”<br>2. A characteristic that only creatures have. See rule <a href="#cr302.4">302.4</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosTournament">Tournament</a></b><br>
An organized play activity where players compete against other players. See rule <a href="#cr100.6">100.6</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosTournament Rules">Tournament Rules</a></b><br>
Additional rules that apply to games played in a sanctioned tournament. See rule <a href="#cr100.6">100.6</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosTraditional Magic Card">Traditional Magic Card</a></b><br>
A Magic card that measures approximately 2.5 inches (6.3 centimeters) by 3.5 inches (8.8 centimeters) and is included in players’ decks. See rule <a href="#cr108.2">108.2</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosTraining">Training</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that means “Whenever this creature and at least one other creature with power greater that this creature’s power attack, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.” See rule <a href="#cr702.149">702.149</a>, “Training.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosTrample">Trample</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that modifies how a creature assigns combat damage. See rule <a href="#cr702.19">702.19</a>, “Trample.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosTrample Over Planeswalkers">Trample Over Planeswalkers</a></b><br>
A variant of trample that modifies how a creature assigns combat damage if it’s attacking a planeswalker. See rule <a href="#cr702.19">702.19</a>, “Trample”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosTransfigure">Transfigure</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets a player search their library for a replacement creature card. See rule <a href="#cr702.71">702.71</a>, “Transfigure.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosTransform">Transform</a></b><br>
To turn a double-faced card so its other face is up. See rule <a href="#cr701.28">701.28</a>, “Transform.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosTransforming Double-Faced Cards">Transforming Double-Faced Cards</a></b><br>
One of two kinds of double-faced cards. Transforming double-faced cards default to their front faces but can transform to their back faces in some way. See rule <a href="#cr712">712</a>, “Double-Faced Cards.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosTransmute">Transmute</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets a player search their library for a replacement card. See rule <a href="#cr702.53">702.53</a>, “Transmute.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosTreasure Token">Treasure Token</a></b><br>
A Treasure token is a colorless artifact token with “{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.” For more information about predefined tokens, see rule <a href="#cr111.10">111.10</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosTrial">Trial</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows an opponent to chose between losing life and giving a spell additional effects. See rule <a href="#cr702.170">702.170</a>, “Trial.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosTribal">Tribal</a></b><br>
A card type. Whether or not a tribal is a permanent depends on its other card type. See rule <a href="#cr308">308</a>, “Tribals.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosTribute">Tribute</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows an opponent to choose between a creature entering the battlefield with +1/+1 counters or an additional ability. See rule <a href="#cr702.104">702.104</a>, “Tribute.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosTrigger">Trigger</a></b><br>
Whenever a game event or game state matches a triggered ability’s trigger event, that ability automatically “triggers.” That means its controller puts it on the stack the next time a player would receive priority. See rule <a href="#cr603">603</a>, “Handling Triggered Abilities.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosTrigger Condition">Trigger Condition</a></b><br>
The first part of a triggered ability, consisting of “when,” “whenever,” or “at” followed by a trigger event. See rule <a href="#cr603">603</a>, “Handling Triggered Abilities.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosTrigger Event">Trigger Event</a></b><br>
The event that a triggered ability looks for. Whenever the trigger event occurs, the triggered ability triggers. See rule <a href="#cr603">603</a>, “Handling Triggered Abilities.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosTriggered Ability">Triggered Ability</a></b><br>
A kind of ability. Triggered abilities begin with the word “when,” “whenever,” or “at.” They’re written as “[Trigger condition], [effect].” See rule <a href="#cr113">113</a>, “Abilities,” and rule <a href="#cr603">603</a>, “Handling Triggered Abilities.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosTurn Markers">Turn Markers</a></b><br>
Markers used to keep track of which players are taking turns in a Grand Melee game. See rule <a href="#cr807.4">807.4</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosTurn-Based Actions">Turn-Based Actions</a></b><br>
Game actions that happen automatically when certain steps or phases begin, or when each step or phase ends. See rule <a href="#cr703">703</a>, “Turn-Based Actions.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosTwo-Headed Giant Variant">Two-Headed Giant Variant</a></b><br>
A multiplayer variant played among two-player teams that each have a shared life total and take a simultaneous turn. See rule <a href="#cr810">810</a>, “Two-Headed Giant Variant.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosType">Type</a></b><br>
1. An object’s card type or, more broadly, its card type, subtype, and/or supertype. See rule <a href="#cr205">205</a>, “Type Line,” and <a href="#cr3">section 3</a>, “Card Types.”<br>2. An attribute mana has. See rule <a href="#cr106">106</a>, “Mana.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosType Icon">Type Icon</a></b><br>
An icon that appears in the upper left of some Future Sight cards that has no effect on game play. See rule <a href="#cr107.10">107.10</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosType Line">Type Line</a></b><br>
Part of a card. The type line is printed directly below the illustration and contains the card’s card type(s), subtype(s), and/or supertype(s). See rule <a href="#cr205">205</a>, “Type Line.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosType-Changing Effect">Type-Changing Effect</a></b><br>
An effect that changes an object’s card type, subtype, and/or supertype. See rules <a href="#cr205.1a">205.1a</a>–b, 305.7, and <a href="#cr613.1d">613.1d</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosTypecycling">Typecycling</a></b><br>
A variant of the cycling ability. See rule <a href="#cr702.29">702.29</a>, “Cycling.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosUnattach">Unattach</a></b><br>
To move an Equipment away from the creature it’s attached to so that the Equipment is on the battlefield but is not equipping anything. See rule <a href="#cr701.3d">701.3d</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosUnblockable (Obsolete)">Unblockable (Obsolete)</a></b><br>
A term that meant “can’t be blocked.” Cards that used this term have received errata in the Oracle card reference.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosUnblocked Creature">Unblocked Creature</a></b><br>
An attacking creature once no creature has been declared as a blocker for it, unless an effect has caused it to become blocked. It remains an unblocked creature until it’s removed from combat or the combat phase ends, whichever comes first. See rule <a href="#cr509">509</a>, “Declare Blockers Step.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosUndaunted">Undaunted</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that reduces the cost of a spell based on the number of opponents you have. See rule <a href="#cr702.125">702.125</a>, “Undaunted.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosUndying">Undying</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that can return a creature from the graveyard to the battlefield. See rule <a href="#cr702.93">702.93</a>, “Undying.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosUnearth">Unearth</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets a player return a creature card from their graveyard to the battlefield. See rule <a href="#cr702.84">702.84</a>, “Unearth.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosUnflipped">Unflipped</a></b><br>
A default status a permanent may have. See rule <a href="#cr110.5">110.5</a> and rule <a href="#cr710">710</a>, “Flip Cards.” See also Flipped.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosUnleash">Unleash</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that allows a creature to enter the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it and stops it from blocking if it has a +1/+1 counter on it. See rule <a href="#cr702.98">702.98</a>, “Unleash.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosUnless">Unless</a></b><br>
A word used to indicate a certain style of cost. See rule <a href="#cr118.12a">118.12a</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosUntap">Untap</a></b><br>
To rotate a permanent back to the upright position from a sideways position. See rule <a href="#cr701.21">701.21</a>, “Tap and Untap.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosUntap Step">Untap Step</a></b><br>
Part of the turn. This step is the first step of the beginning phase. See rule <a href="#cr502">502</a>, “Untap Step.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosUntap Symbol">Untap Symbol</a></b><br>
The untap symbol {Q} in an activation cost means “Untap this permanent.” See rule <a href="#cr107.6">107.6</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosUntapped">Untapped</a></b><br>
A default status a permanent may have. See rule <a href="#cr110.5">110.5</a> and rule <a href="#cr701.21">701.21</a>, “Tap and Untap.” See also Tapped.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosUpgrade">Upgrade</a></b><br>
A keyword action that puts a counter of a type the upgrading permanent doesn't have on it. See rule <a href="#cr701.74">701.74</a>, “Upgrade.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosUpkeep Step">Upkeep Step</a></b><br>
Part of the turn. This step is the second step of the beginning phase. See rule <a href="#cr503">503</a>, “Upkeep Step.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosVancouver Mulligan">Vancouver Mulligan</a></b><br>
Informal term for a previous system of taking a mulligan. Using the Vancouver mulligan, a player who took a mulligan shuffled their hand into their library and drew one fewer card. After choosing to not mulligan, a player who took a mulligan looked at the top card of their library and could put it on the bottom of their library. For current mulligan rules, see rule <a href="#cr103.4">103.4</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosVanguard">Vanguard</a></b><br>
1. A casual variant in which each player plays the role of a famous character. See rule <a href="#cr902">902</a>, “Vanguard.”<br>2. A card type seen only on nontraditional Magic cards in the Vanguard casual variant. A vanguard card is not a permanent. See rule <a href="#cr312">312</a>, “Vanguards.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosVanishing">Vanishing</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that limits how long a permanent remains on the battlefield. See rule <a href="#cr702.63">702.63</a>, “Vanishing.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosVariant">Variant</a></b><br>
An additional set of rules that determines the style of a multiplayer game. See rule <a href="#cr800.2">800.2</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosVehicle">Vehicle</a></b><br>
An artifact subtype. Vehicles can become artifact creatures. See rule <a href="#cr301">301</a>, “Artifacts,” and rule <a href="#cr702.122">702.122</a>, “Crew.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosVenture Marker">Venture Marker</a></b><br>
A marker used to track which room of a dungeon card a player is currently in. See rule <a href="#cr309">309</a>, “Dungeons.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosVenture into the Dungeon">Venture into the Dungeon</a></b><br>
A keyword action that can bring dungeon cards into the game from outside the game or move a player’s venture marker. See rule <a href="#cr701.46">701.46</a>, “Venture into the Dungeon.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosVessel">Vessel</a></b><br>
A Vessel is an enchantment token that allows a player to pay {2} and sacrifice it to create a 1/1 flying Spirit token. See rule C111.10a<br>
<br><b><a id="glosVigilance">Vigilance</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that lets a creature attack without tapping. See rule <a href="#cr702.20">702.20</a>, “Vigilance.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosVision">Vision</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that reveals cards for effects whenever any creature with vision enters the battlefield. See rule <a href="#cr702.179">702.179</a>, “Vision.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosVote">Vote</a></b><br>
Some cards instruct players to vote from among given options. See rule <a href="#cr701.32">701.32</a>, “Vote.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosVoyage">Voyage</a></b><br>
A keyword action that causes a permanent to phase out, then have some effect when it phases in. See rule <a href="#cr701.72">701.72</a>, “Voyage.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosWalker Token">Walker Token</a></b><br>
A Walker token is a 2/2 black Zombie creature token named Walker. For more information on predefined tokens, see rule <a href="#cr111.10">111.10</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosWall">Wall</a></b><br>
A creature type with no particular rules meaning. Older cards with the Wall creature type but without defender had an unwritten ability that precluded them from attacking. Those cards have received errata in the Oracle card reference to have defender. Some older cards that referenced the Wall creature type have also received errata. See Defender.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosWard">Ward</a></b><br>
A triggered ability that can counter spells or abilities that target the permanent with ward. See rule <a href="#cr702.21">702.21</a>, “Ward.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosWin the Game">Win the Game</a></b><br>
There are several ways to win the game. See rule <a href="#cr104">104</a>, “Ending the Game,” and rules <a href="#cr810.8">810.8</a> (for additional rules for Two-Headed Giant games) and rule <a href="#cr809.5">809.5</a> (for additional rules for Emperor games).<br>
<br><b><a id="glosWinnow">Winnow</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that causes damage dealt to a creature to also cause its controller to lose that much life. See rule <a href="#cr702.171">702.171</a>, “Winnow.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosWither">Wither</a></b><br>
A keyword ability that affects how an object deals damage to a creature. See rule <a href="#cr702.80">702.80</a>, “Wither.”<br>
<br>
<b><a id="glosWorld">World</a></b><br>
A supertype that’s normally relevant on enchantments. See rule <a href="#cr205.4">205.4</a>, “Supertypes.” See also World Rule.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosWorld Rule">World Rule</a></b><br>
A state-based action that causes all permanents with the world supertype except the one that has had the world supertype for the shortest amount of time are put into their owners’ graveyards. See rule <a href="#cr704.5k">704.5k</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosX">X</a></b><br>
A placeholder for a number that needs to be determined. See rule <a href="#cr107.3">107.3</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosY">Y</a></b><br>
See <a href="#glosX">X</a>.<br>
<br><b><a id="glosYou">You, Your</a></b><br>
Words that refer to an object’s controller, its would-be controller (if a player is attempting to cast or activate it), or its owner (if it has no controller). See rule <a href="#cr109.5">109.5</a>.<br>
<br>
<b><a id="glosZone">Zone</a></b><br>
A place where objects can be during a game. See <a href="#cr4">section 4</a>, “Zones.”<br>
<br><b><a id="glosZone-Change Triggers">Zone-Change Triggers</a></b><br>
Trigger events that involve objects changing zones. See rule <a href="#cr603.6">603.6</a>.<br>
<br>
<b><a id="glosportfolio">portfolio</a></b><br>
Advisors, artifacts, and enchantments a player control are in their portfolio. See rule C700.17.<br>
<br><h2><a id="commentary">Commentary</a></h2>
<a href="#cr205.1a"><b>205.1a</b></a>, <a href="#cr205.3c"><b>205.3c</b></a>: <a id="com205">These rules allow the Project type (and any other) to be shared by artifacts and enchantments.</a><br>
<a href="#cr401.1"><b>401.1</b></a>, <a href="#cr401.2"><b>401.2</b></a>: <a id="com401">This just adds 'main' library to differentiate from additional libraries.</a><br>
<a href="#cr601.2b"><b>601.2b</b></a>: <a id="com601">This adjusts the casting process so Choose X modals work, such as for X-spells.</a><br>
<a href="#cr613.4e"><b>613.4e</b></a>: <a id="com613">Adds a new layer to resolve the conflict that would arise from Platinum Colossus and Gos, Knotweald Elder.</a><br>
<a href="#cr700.2"><b>700.2</b></a>: <a id="com700.2">Adjusts the definition of modal to allow reference to a 'modal card'.</a><br>
<a href="#cr702.139"><b>702.139</b></a>: <a id="comCompanion">This is a rewrite of the Companion keyword to allow for variants that have different conditions for being brought into the game. Currently only has First mates, but others can be added easily now.</a><br>
<a href="#cr716"><b>716</b></a>: <a id="comAdventure">This is a rewrite of the Adventurer Cards section to allow for variants other than Adventure. Currently this only has Tales, but others can be added easily now.</a><br>
<a href="#cr723.2k"><b>723.2k</b></a>: <a id="comMerge">This defines what happens when a merge stack gets two effects like "CARDNAME's power and toughness are each equal to...", which is currently impossible on canon and has no rule.</a><br>
